choices: Help Roxy Out in the Infirmary
Help Elisa Teach the Guests How to Ski
Get Some Breakfast at the Cafe
1.content:
You wake up and let out a yawn. You look out the window of your winter house. You couldn’t stay at the lifeguard station during the winter so Roxy’s friend Elisa built you a new house out of an old cuckoo clock she found in her basement. You still couldn’t believe it was the cold season already. You remember the last day of Summer. Fran gave everyone their last paycheck of the season and sent you, Stella, Roxy and Chihiro away. Chihiro quit her job at the beach and went to Fearfield to get a new job, April went back to her workshop in town and Mesa said something about heading to another job she had back in the countryside. As for Stella, you don’t even want to know.

You didn’t know what to do during the winter, until Roxy mentioned she worked at Grimmsly Lodge in the mountains, a ski resort and told you they were looking for ski instructors. She introduced you to her Bahamut friend Elisa and while you were intimidated at first when the hippo/fish/dragon monster looked down and smiled at you, you two became friends and she and Roxy convinced the manager to hire you. You’ve been working there for a few years now, as long as you’ve worked at Gravefield Beach.

You weren’t so much for cold weather though and there were dinosaurs in the mountainside, a lot of which were carnivores, but there were two things you liked best about working at the lodge. There was no Stella to condescend you and there was no way you’d run into that mermaid Paisley. You were in an environment where your most hated predator couldn’t possibly survive. It was perfect. But as you get up, you feel a cold breeze and start to shiver. This job wasn’t like your old job at the beach at all. It’s so terrifyingly cold even indoors and you have to quickly put on your jacket, gloves and earmuffs.

So, what are you going to do today?
1.title: A Cold Day in Terrordale

choices: You and Roxy are Sent to Fly Over the Area
Elisa Comes in with an injured Monster
You Both Hear an Explosion From Downstairs
Corey Comes in for a Surprise Inspection
11.content:
You decide to check up on Roxy. Since you already work with her everyday in the Summer, you figure that you might as well see what’s going on with the big gargoyle girl. You walk out of your house and climb down the stairway installed specifically for you and make your way to the nurse’s office. Roxy worked as a nurse during the winter, which made sense since she worked as a lifeguard in the summer. Sometimes she was even sent to fly out and look for anyone who might be in trouble.

You reach the nurse’s office and walk right under the door to see Roxy was already here and humming to herself as she was organizing medicine. Roxy was wearing a bright white nurse’s outfit with slight pink highlights. You didn’t want to say it, but you think Roxy’s been putting on weight lately. Of course she was always big boned, even in the Summer, but she got even bigger in the winter. But you’d never say it to her face. Roxy was sensitive about her weight and once threw you right into a large tree when you pointed it out to her.

As Roxy is humming to herself, you see her lizard like tail moving back and forth and run forward and grab the tip before climbing up one of the gargoyle giantess’s wings. You’re about to climb to Roxy’s neck but Roxy flaps the wing and you fall yelling down the wing until you fall deep between Roxy’s giant yellow breasts. Your gargoyle friend feels the impact as her breasts and belly shake and she smiles. “Hi Stephen.” She says. “He, hey Roxy.” You say nervously.

Roxy shakes her enormous mammaries and smiles down on you. “Don’t get up, you can stay there. I’ll let you out when I need you.” You sink further down the cleavage and are stuck between two yellow mountains of gargoyle flesh. You let out a sigh, but you don’t mind. Given how cold this lodge gets, you could use the extra warmth. But knowing you and Roxy, you’ll both see some excitement soon.
11.title: Nurse Roxy

112.content:
As you kick back and relax between Roxy's boobs, you start to hear a phone ringing. Your gargoyle friend walks up and answers the phone. "Hello?" asked Roxy. "Hey Maza," said a familiar voice on the phone. "It's Elisa." Elisa was Roxy's best friend and a bahamut, a creature resembling a cross between a hippo and a fish, apparently with a dragon thrown in for good measures. She was a ski instructor at the lodge.

"Hey Elisa," says Roxy. "You hippo headed rascal. What's up?" "I was taking a beginner on the slopes and the little hot dog tried to write a check her ass couldn't catch. I need you to prepare the infirmary right away. Elisa out." Roxy let out a sigh. "Well Stephen," she says to you as she lifts up her ample cleavage. "It looks like we're going to work already.

You hear loud footsteps and realize that it was a particularly heavy monster coming, the shadow wasn't tall enough to be Camille and the shape of the head didn't look like a loxodon or a minotaur so it couldn't be Elektra or Comet. Then you notice the shadow has a pair of wings and the head of a hippopotamus. It was Elisa and she was carrying the injured monster inside.

The question is, what kind of monster was it? You don't think you've seen Elisa's student before.
112.title: Emergency

choices: Corey comes in and fails the place
1122.content:
"Oh my body." Serena the Basilisk said just as she was coming in for an extremely big reason, she was really really really injured, and she was now lying on the bed. From the look of the monster, it looked like Serena can move her arms and head alright, but her legs are just frozen up solid as if it was paraylzed from the waist down. Man this could be really bad. "Her real injury is that she was hit by a wrench from a crashing car, and it hit her so hard that her body just shutdown the legs." Elisa said, noticing how Serena cannot move almost at all.

"Oh man, and we don't know what to do in this situation as it's so severe. We need to call the hospital immediately." you said to the group. Roxy got on the phone just as you and Elisa try to help Serena out.

"How are you doing?" you asked her. "I am fine, but man it's going to suck not being here now." Serena replied to you.

What happens now?
1122.title: Serena- A Basilisk

choices: Alexander- A human not unlike yourself
Sabrina- A werewolf girl. with silver fur.
1123.content: If it wasn't any of those, how about one of these?
1123.title: More Options

choices: Stay and relax for a bit
11233.content:
Elisa appears to be carrying a werewolf with silver fur. She sets her down and Roxy does the same to you. As you observe Roxy checking her over you notice that the patient has a nice full figure. She's not overweight but definitely has some meat. Roxy goes to get some bandages, leaving you alone for a second. You're right near the werewolf's head, and start to feel her breathing on you. She seems to be waking up. You're glad she's okay but then she begins sniffing. Her eyes are still closed but she seems to zero in on you. Before you can act her tongue rolls out and scoops you up. "Rox-" you start before you're dragged into her mouth. Inside you are tossed around as she tastes you and sucks on you like a piece of candy. You crash into her teeth and thank god that she's still only half awake. Otherwise she might start chewing.

Roxy walks back over to treat the girl's wounds. She took a spill and got a cut on her arm, but nothing serious. She notices that you're not there and looks around confused. Its then that she sees the girl is breathing steadily. She's relieved but then notices that she has something in her mouth. Putting two and two together she decides to investigate. Taking her claws she gently pries open the wolf's jaws. You spill out and crawl away as fast as you can. You're covered in saliva and begin wiping it out of your eyes. "Thanks Roxy, how did you know?" you say to your gargoyle partner. "Hey, when your partner is human, you get used to certain situations." she says. You laugh a little. "Yeah I guess I'm getting used to stuff like that too." Roxy goes ahead and patches the girl up. After about ten minutes she stirs and sits up.

"Where am I?" she asks. "You're in the infirmary." Roxy answers. "You took a spill during snowboard lessons and passed out. You just have a scratch, so its nothing to worry about." The werewolf checks her arm. "Well thanks for helping me out. My name's Sabrina." she says. "No problem its my job. I'm Roxy by the way, and this is my partner Stephen." she says and holds you out. "Hey, I'm Stephen." you tell the giant werewolf. "We've already sort of been acquainted. You kind of tried to eat me while you were out." Sabrina reaches out and pats your head. "Sorry about that little guy. Instincts must have kicked in. I don't normally eat humans, but sometimes I slip." she says. You're relieved that she's friendly. Its good to know she won't try to devour you. Now that she's okay, what does she want to do?
11233.title: Sabrina- A werewolf girl. with silver fur.

112331.content:
"You should take it easy and rest a while." Roxy said and Sabrina let out a snarl of agitation but decided that she should rest and laid back down. "Yo Rox, check on the other patients. Now that our friend here is conscious, she probably won't be trying to eat me again." you tell Roxy and she nods and leaves to tend to the others.

"My name is Sabrina by the way." said the werewolf and you blush as she tells you her name. "Nice to meet you Sabrina. Are you from around here or are you new here?".
112331.title: Stay and relax for a bit

choices: "would you like to hang out with me today at the lodge?"
1123311.content:
The question seemingly caused a smile to appear upon Sabrina's muzzle. "well...truth be told, I was born here." she admits whole heartedly as her eyes slowly drifted up towards the ceiling of the infirmary. "well...close by here to be honest." she adds with a small chuckle. "I still remember the days when I was just a young pup, playing about with my family upon the nearby mountains."

As Sabrina began to take a trip down nostalgia lane, curiosity as well as the opportunity to get better acquainted soon urged you to press on with questions. "really? what games did you play when you were younger?" you ask with a small smile on your face. "were they the basics like snowball fights and sledding?" the assumptions immediately cause Sabrina to giggle as she turns her great head to gaze down straight at you.

"More than that." she admits giving a toothy albeit warm grin. "me and my siblings would always stay out either racing with each other in the snow, or simply playing a game of howl and seek." she chuckles as you begin to slowly raise a brow by the oddly named game.

"Howl and seek?" you repeat in a manner almost like a parrot would to a pirate captain. "what's that?..." Immediately, your eyes widen unsure if you just insulted the great lupine before you by the simple question. "e-errr, I don't mean to sound offensive or anything, it's just....well since I'm a human, I'm not really...smart with monster games." you admit with no hesitation. To your surprise, your back is soon met by the soft yet leathery surface of Sabrina's huge furred finger rubbing your back.

"No offense taken." she chuckles. "well, Howl and seek is a game where one wolf acts as leader, trying to find the other missing pack members. Only problem though is that all the other pack members are hiding and we aren't allowed to use our noses to track them."

"then...how exactly are you suppose to find them?" you ask curiously only to cause another giggle to erupt from Sabrina.

"simple. We howl." she answers. "once the leaders howl, all the other pack members have to howl to. That way, we could know whether they're close or far." the whole rules of the game were extremely, if not an exact mirrored version of the common Marco Polo game you always played in the pool. In fact, the great similarities end up growing your smile ever so slightly.

"Ah! I get it now." you reply with a nod. Sabrina smiles as she slowly attempts to get into a sitting position. Just as you were going to insist on her lying down, she surprisingly manages to sit up with hardly any sign of pain or cringe on her face.

"well...seems like I'm doing a lot better now." she states while shrugging her shoulders in a circular like motion. After giving a small stretch, her eyes soon fall upon your tiny form as she slowly kneels down above you. "well...it was great to talk to you." she says giving a nod. "but...I was wondering..."
1123311.title: She grew up here.

choices: You and her make it inside.
Something happens while walking towards there.
11233111.content:
Within seconds, Sabrina soon averts her eyes away from you in a rather awkward manner. "w-well...I was wondering..." she repeats once again before once again gazing don upon you. "would you like to hang out with me today at the lodge?" she asks in a soft yet slightly nervous voice

Your eyes widen in surprise by the offer, but overall you're just grateful she isn't risky enough to go back on the slopes to soon. "sure." you reply giving a smile up at her. "wouldn't hurt to hang out with you." you answer as a smile began to grow upon Sabrina's muzzle.

"thank you Stephen." she says before gingerly lowering her hands down in front of you. With little hesitation, you began to scramble our way upon her massive hand before making your way to the center of her padded palm. Once you were in a secured position, she slowly makes her way up from the bed and proceeds to make her way to the desk of the infirmary. After signing some basic information regarding her injury it wasn't too long before you and her began the trek to the lodge. Once she was out in the white landscape of the mountains, a small shiver ends up running down your spine from the sudden breezes emerging. Even if you were dressed in layers of clothes, your size and the overall chilliness of the mountain didn't seem to do much against the bitterness of the cold.

As it turned out, you weren't the only one who noticed the cold temperatures. Above, Sabrina was gazing down at you noticing your sudden shivers upon her hand. "cold?" she asks while tilting her head slightly to the sides in a canine manner.

Your attention soon snaps to her face as you shake your head. "i'm fine." you say not wanting to seem like a burden to a guest at the lodge.

"I know you're lying." Sabrina quickly says accusingly with a slight scowl on her face.

"no need to worry." you quickly retort. "I'm dressed perfectly for this weather." you reply in a rather assuring tone before another cool breeze causes a shiver to run down your body.

"I'm not convinced." Sabrina says with the scowl still on her face. "here, this should help." immediately your tiny form was brought upwards closing in to her neck.

"Sabrina? what are you-" before even having a chance to finish your question, a huge blush ends up enveloping your face as you found out where you were being lead. With a small drop, you soon found yourself nestled right above the soft furred cleavage of the huge wolfess. All about you, her warmth radiated making you forget momentarily about the cold temperatures outside.

"Is that better?" she asks as her eyes focused upon your hidden form.

"e-errr..." you stammer trying to think of the right words to say. "well, it is warm." you reply causing Sabrina to let out a small giggle and bounce you about in her sweater.

"Well glad I could help." she answers as she continues onwards towards the lodge
11233111.title: "would you like to hang out with me today a...

112331111.content:
It wasn't too long before both you and Sabrina enter into the warm interior of the building. Sabrina gives a long sigh of relief as you remain nestled against her extremely comfy fur. "we made it." she says gazing down at you with a smile on her muzzle. A sudden giggle erupts above shaking you slightly as her eyes were transfixed upon your position. "comfy down there?" she asks in a rather coy grin.

A great blush soon grows on your face as you try your best to get up on your feet. "it did keep me warm." you admit , trying to hide the fact that you actually did enjoy remaining besides her chest. Trying your best not to seem like a pervert, you try to clamber your way to her neck (or at least attempt to) as your efforts were soon proved futile. With one small misstep, your form soon ends up sliding down the valley of grey fur sending you even a bit further than your previous position. Above Sabrina simply laughs at your actions as you quickly grasps some tufts of fur to avoid getting bounced about.

"No need to be shy." she chuckles as she attempts to lower her head so her snout was before you. "I don't mind you staying there. In fact, I think it's understandable why a human would just want to be there." she states in an understanding tone. "it's warm and soft...plus the view must be great." She says in a rather humorous, if not teasing tone. The crimson shade on your face immediately began to grow darker by her words. Was she just joking, or did she just suspect that you were actually trying to catch a glimpse down her cleavage?

"anyways, what should we do first?" She asks while tilting her head lightly to the side. "would you like to get a small bite to eat? or...would you just like to hang out in my room for the day?"
112331111.title: You and her make it inside.

113.content:
Suddenly as you're curled up in Roxy's cleavage, there's a loud explosion that sounds like it came from downstairs. "Holy crap!" yells Roxy. "What was that?" "Oh no," you say. "That came from downstairs. Helga and Lydia!" Roxy runs out of the nurse's office with you bouncing in her cleavage and you almost slip as you grab hold of the gargoyle woman's bra strap.

As Roxy reaches the stairway Azure runs forward on all fours, Vernon holding onto her hair on the top of her head. "What happened now?" asks Vernon. "I don't care," says Azure. "Roxy! Do you have a first aid kit ready?" Roxy nods her head and holds up a kit as Elisa comes in with a fire extinguisher. "I told you that having a scientist and a sorceress living downstairs was asking for trouble," the bahamut says. "Who do you think caused that explosion?" "We'll sort it out later," says Azure. "That explosion could've caused a fire."

All of you run downstairs and you see that there was indeed a fire. "Elisa!" you shout. "Over there!" Elisa takes out the fire extinguisher and begins to put out the flames, but there is still smoke coming from down the hall. "It's coming from one of their labs." you say. Azure lets out a groan. "Those two finally did it. They're burning down the lodge."

"Now look what you've done you bridge dweller!" yells Lydia's shrill voice. "What I'VE done?" asks Helga's voice. "Look what YOU'VE done you fat weasel! This is on your head!" "Yeah right! If we survive I'm going to kill you for this!" "Go ahead and try hairball, because Azure is going to kill us both for your stupidity!" "They're alive," says Roxy. "But they could still be in danger!" The five of you run down the hall and see more smoke from the explosion.

Sure enough you see....
113.title: The Exploding Basement

choices: Lydia and Helga successfully team up, and stop the fire!
And Now For Something Completely Different....
1133.content:
Even with all the weirdness you've seen in your life, all the times you'd gotten sat on, stepped on and (nearly) eaten; spending most of your adult life living around giant monster women didn't quite prepare you for the sight that granted you down the hall.

Helga and Lydia were standing with their faces inches from each other, both wearing furious death glares that would have melted the armor off a battleship as they kept up their shouting match...and ignoring a thick clouds of smoke that were pouring in around them, from both their respective rooms. Lydia's wand actually drooped in her hand as she gesticulated with it wildly--that thing was made of metal; just how hot WAS this fire?!--and her cape was on fire, though she ignored this. She was too busy ranting.

"I TOLD you to keep your TOYS away from my potions!" Lydia snapped, her pink ears twitching. "Tinkerers like you may not understand how magic works, but even all those disgusting...machines--" She spat, like she'd eaten something disgusting, "--need a little care to cobble together! I figured you'd at least respect my workshop, you clockwork-worshiping, steampunk-addicted--"

Roxy clears her throat; with you in her cleavage and the building smoke it knocked the wind out of you. "Erm, ladies?"

Roxy went unanswered as Helga cut her off, pushing back against Lydia and pressing their faces even closer together. If not for the troll's glasses, the two women's eyeballs would have ground against each other. "I kept my machines under perfect control, you little Luddite rodent! YOU were the one who went around slinging those...insults to logic you call 'spells' around without warning ME! What, you didn't think that whatever overblown party trick you were doing would affect metal?! Maybe you should have read those molded spell books of yours a little better; or better yet, stop it with this occult bullshit and take some damn science classes!!"

Azure growls, her lip curling. "Hey! Listen, you two.."

It was getting hotter; the smoke was getting worse. Already you could hear alarms going off. Crap, and you'd just woken up....

Lydia looked ready to bludgeon Helga with her (partially-melted) wand. "My spells can outdo ANYTHING your stupid contraptions can do, and that's a fact--no, wait; it's a law of nature! Machines are only for lazy bi--"

"QUIET, GODDAMMIT!! BOTH OF YOU!!!"

Azure's roar stops the argument dead in its tracks. Mostly because its targets were clutching their ears in pain and wearing faces like they'd been punched in the stomach. At their first sign of recovery, you werecoyote boss bellows again, though not as thunderous as before. "You two can have this pissing contest later--and no, I won't hear one freaking word about who started it!! Unless you two want to pay for the reconstruction yourselves, you'll kindly stop bickering and help us put out this fire before it burns this lodge to the ground!!"

Still holding their ears, both Lydia and Helga cease their shouting and look around...and immediately start coughing horrifically. Roxy tosses them some face-masks she'd nabbed from a first-aid kit, gesturing for everyone to squat down and get under the smoke. Elisa, given her girth, has to squat especially low. "I won't ask exactly how this happened; just tell us, can we put this out and save the lodge?" the Bahamat asks, glaring at the pair over her snout.

"Yes, it can be put out." Lydia's answer was immediate. "The potions that got mixed when...the incident happened.." she glared at Helga but made no further commentary; "...were volatile stuff, but the fire itself is mundane. One of those extinguisher-contraptions would do, but I managed to snatch some anti-catalyst potion." She reached into her cape and produced a sizable flash of a fizzy, blue liquid. "This will cancel out the reactions instantly, and kill the fire."

Admirably, Helga kept herself from any commentary of her own, though she winced when her rival had pulled the potion from seemingly nowhere (thus slapping the laws of material space square in the jaw),and even with her wearing the surgical mask you could see her smirk when Lydia described said potion using words like "catalyst" and "reaction". The troll girl looked at her workshop and reported, "The fire in MY room is small, but it's burning like crazy and there's some nasty fumes building up. Some of my machines are still undamaged by all the heat, and they could help us put these fires out...that water-cannon I made last week can douse a whole room!"

"There's your answer, then!" Vernon coughs, from atop Azure's head. "We can use Lydia's potion AND Helga's contraptions--maybe even together!--to put out this fire! If they're as good as you say they are, we'll have this under control in no time!" Despite the smoke and blaring alarms, he's grinning like a loon. Elisa, Roxy, and you all give feverish nods, hoping against hope the two girls will be sensible and put aside their rivalry for once...


===What Happens Next?===
1133.title: Science vs. Magic (FYI: They're *Both* Twits)

choices: You Go with Roxy and Follow Helga
You Go with Elisa and Follow Lydia
11332.content:
As the fires keep on burning, both Helga and Lydia look to each other. You seriously hope that both of them would bury the hatchet before Grimmsly Lodge burns to the ground. However, Helga and Lydia still glare at each other. It would seem even in a dire situation, the troll and weasel giantesses weren't too keen on working together. "Are you kidding?" asks Helga. "You're putting the fate of the entire lodge in the hands of that bubble butted stoat and her crazy potion? How do we even know that thing will work? For all we know, it could be made out of something flammable that would make the fire worse." Lydia gets made and holds up her claws dangerously close Helga's face.

"It's a magic potion, Helga," says Lydia through gritted teeth. "It doesn't matter!" "Magic?" asks Helga. "What a load of minotaur." "You're a troll! A creature related to fairies! Something that humans used to believe were creatures of mythology." "Well, most trolls can't use magic! It's nature telling us not to rely on such flights of fancy." Azure grunts and slaps herself in the face. "You IDIOTS! Can't you see that there's a fire! We could all be killed here!" Vernon let out a groan and held his face. "I'm the idiot for thinking those two could work together."

Helga grunts and then attempts to bring out a machine that looks like some high-tech pump with a firehose attached to it. Lydia is less than impressed. "That's what you're planning on putting out the fire with? It looks like an oversized toilet cleaner." Helga gives a growl and holds up the hose. "Oh yeah?" she asks. Lydia takes out another potion and out of spite, pours it down the fire hose. The potion then bubbles up and hardens, rendering the hose useless as Helga tries to turn it on. "You moron!" yells Azure. "What did you do that for?! That could've been useful!" You and Roxy shake your heads. Those two had some really messed up priorities.

Suddenly the fire grows more intense and Elisa gives a grunt. The hippo/dragon hybrid breathes fire at of her mouth at the flames that are coming in fast. "Elisa!" yells Azure. "What are you doing?!" Elisa points out that the fire is less intense than before. "Fighting fire with fire," says Elisa. "Literally. Come on, Roxy, we need to put out these flames. Leave those two fools to argue." Roxy and Elisa burst through a burned wall and see the fire spreading. Wasting no time, they both flap their wings in order to fan the flames. Outside, several of the other staff are busy hoping to put out the flames. Felicia and Connie are escorting the guests out while Victoria tosses snowballs at the flames and Elektra sprays water from her trunk. "Good grief," says Felicia. "What a calamity."

- - - -

A half hour later, the flames have been put out. Fortunately, nobody was hurt. The bad news was that a good chunk of the lodge was burned, including Azure's office. Azure let out a groan and lowered her head. "My lodge," she says. "Look at the damage that fire did to my lodge. I had a Gimghoul Painting in there worth thousands of skulls!" "At least nobody got hurt," says Vernon. "But it'll take weeks to repair this damage." You sit on Elisa's shoulder as both Helga and Lydia give nervous looks. Suddenly, Azure turns to face the two and she is pissed.

"You imbeciles! You mean to tell me that you two despise each other so much that you couldn't be bothered to work together when our lives were in danger! For all I know, one or both of you caused that fire in the first place!" "It's her fault!" yells Helga pointing an accusing finger to Lydia. "You're a liar!" yells Lydia. "I'll bet one of your contraptions short-circuited and caught fire." "If that's true, maybe you sabotaged it. Then again, that would require brains."

"SHUT UP!" shouts Azure right before she slaps both of them in the face so hard that it leaves an imprint. Your coyote boss roars so loud that even Vernon is scared. "Because you two were too busy arguing to stop half the lodge from burning down, you two have to pay for repairs! And you'll both be extremely lucky if I don't evict you afterwards!" Lydia bites her lip. "I'm kind of short on cash this month." "Same here." Says Helga. Azure growls. "Well then, you better get the money. I don't care if you have to sell your own organs. I want you both to get the money in seven days or else!"

Lydia and Helga grumble and then go off to find work to earn enough money to fix the lodge. "Loser." Mutters Lydia. "Jerk." Says Helga. Azure lets out a sigh and turns to face you, Roxy and Elisa. "I want you three to follow those idiots and make sure they don't do anything stupid." You all nod your heads.

Exactly who are you going to follow?
11332.title: They're Both Idiots

choices: She Comes Back Empty Handed from Job Searching
Surprisingly She Already Has All the Money
113322.content:
You decide to stick with Elisa as she flies over the town and follows after Lydia. “You know, Lydia,” says Elisa. “It wouldn’t kill you to bury the hatchet with Helga. If you too agreed to work together, then that fire wouldn’t have burned down half the lodge. Lydia gave a scoff. “Well,” you say. “Maybe you and Helga should work together. After all, the two of you on your own can’t possibly earn the money to fix Grimmsly Lodge in only 7 days. How much money do you even need to earn.” Elisa gives a snort. “Well,” she says. “Considering how much damage was done, I’d say 100,000 skulls.” “Seriously?” you ask in surprise. “That much? Lydia. You’re in over your head. You should jut find Helga and...”

Lydia casts a spell that makes your mouth disappear and you grunt and groan as the kamaitachi lets out a scoff. “I would rather be handcuffed to Persephone Howler for 13 years than work with that no account gadget head. I can get that money all by myself.” “Lydia!” yells Elisa. “Be realistic. You can’t earn that much money in 7 days by yourself. If you ask me, Azure is being a tad unreasonable with her demands. Lydia gives a scoff before she enters the outskirts of Thrillerville. “I know what I’m doing. Just get off my case and let me make the money my way.” Lydia stomps away as your mouth grows back and you give a deep breath. “That weasel is so stubborn.” You say. Elisa gives a grunt. “Well,” she says. “If she’s going to be that way, we should leave her alone to make her own mistakes. After what happened, she’ll be lucky if Azure doesn’t decide to evict her.” “Evict her?” you ask. “Elisa, Azure looked ready to kill her and Helga both.” Elisa nods her head and then the bahamut hears her big hippopotamus-like belly growl loudly. Elisa taps her stomach and lets out a sigh. “Come on,” she says. “We’ll leave Lydia to stew in her own juices. I’m hungry.”

Elisa stomps up towards a revolving sushi restaurant and plunks herself down in three chairs at once as she begins picking up plates of sushi and gives you a piece of tuna to eat. You turn and see a sign that reads “Help Wanted”. “Hmmm,” you say. “Maybe Lydia or Helga could find a job working here.” Elisa gave a scoff. “Are you kidding? I wouldn’t trust a witch to cook my dinner.” “Elisa,” you say. “This is a sushi shop. No cooking required.” Elisa nods her head as she continues to rack up the plates and even gives a belch. You then hear even more ravenous sounds and see that next to you and Elisa is a bespectacled minotaur giantess with a striped body resembling the pattern of an okapi, a relative of the giraffe, of which is in the same order as bovines. She had long brown hair with silver highlights and she was devouring sushi like it was going out of style. Elisa gave a whistle. “And I thought I had a big appetite.”

The minotaur woman stops eating sushi and turns to face Elisa. “I couldn’t help but overhear,” she says. “You know somebody looking for a job?” You step back in caution. After all, all the minotaurs you knew ate humans and you were afraid this giantess would think you were a tasty treat. The minotaur gives a scoff. “Tell him not to get overheated. I don’t eat humans. In fact, I’m married to one. Anyway, I have three sons and daughter-in-laws who run a restaurant in Direopolis. It’s a good place but after eating here, I’m going to ask them to put sushi on the menu. Getting back on track. One of my daughters-in-law injured herself the other day and they’re looking for a temporary delivery girl. If you know somebody who can do deliveries, I could put in a good word. Trust me, those three boys of mine know better than to argue with me.” Elisa and you blink and actually think about this. “That’s actually a good idea,” you say. “Thanks, Mrs...” The minotaur woman swallows a live eel before speaking. “Viola Poe,” she says. “If your friend shows up and still is looking for a job, don’t hesitate to ask for my help. But it’s got to be before five. I’m heading back to Direopolis today.” With that, Viola gets her big butt off of the 4 damaged stools she was sitting on, pays for her sushi and leaves.

You and Elisa begin to consider recommending Lydia to Viola and her sons when Lydia comes into the sushi shop.
113322.title: Following Lydia

choices: You Reach Direopolis with no Problem
1133221.content:
Lydia comes in, grumbling to herself. "I can't believe they didn't have any job openings," the weasel giantess mutters. "At this rate, I'll be evicted and Helga will be laughing at me. I'll have to rob a bank just to keep Azure pleased." Elisa gives a smirk at Lydia and Lydia looks at her in confusion. "Why are you looking at me like that, Elisa?" Elisa gives a snort. "We might have found you a job, Lydia." Lydia blinks. "What kind of job?" You give a nervous look. "Being a delivery girl for a restaurant." Lydia gives a scoff. "Are you kidding me?" she asks. "That's demeaning." "It beats being homeless," says Elisa. "We just met somebody who can hook you up with a job." Viola waddles her fat butt up towards Lydia to investigate her. "Hmm," says the minotaur. "Name?" "Lydia Kama." "Age?" "23!" "Special skills?" "Magic." "Are you licensed to drive a vehicle of any kind?" "Does a bicycle count?"

Viola lets out a sigh. "Well," she says. "To be honest. I've seen better resumes, but anybody is welcomed to work at Neo Neapolitan. Goodness knows, those boys of mine need all the help they can get." Suddenly your eyes pop. "Neo Neapolitan?" you ask. "Wait. You're Allen, Wes and Norman's mom?" Viola nods her head. "Wait," says Elisa. "Then you're Corona Poe's mother as well." Viola gives a scoff. "Well of course I am," she says. "How many other minotaurs do you know with a surname like Poe. I gotta tell you, those three boys are always getting themselves into trouble. But they're not stupid enough to argue with me." You could believe that. Arguing with one's mother was a terrible idea. Especially when she was a 1300ft high minotaur built like a sumo wrestler.

Lydia just lets out a sigh. "Azure will kill me if I don't reimburse her. I can't really be picky. You got yourself a deal, Mrs. Poe." Viola nods her head and then walks away. "Meet me in my car. I think I can convince Patty and Wes to hire you. If Wes proves stubborn, I'll just stomp him. That always sets the record straight." Lydia just gives a grumble. "Me," she says. "A talented sorceress. Forced to deliver fast food." Lydia goes to follow Viola and you and Elisa stare at each other. "Do you think that she'll be able to earn enough money to pay back Azure for the damages in one week, Elisa?" Elisa just lets out a sigh. "One week delivering takeout won't earn half that much in a month," says Elisa. "We better follow her. She'll need some help."

Elisa takes you and follows Lydia and Viola to a strange looking jalopy of some kind. "That car is ancient," thinks Elisa. "She can't seriously think about driving it." Viola sits in the driver's seat while Lydia sits in the passenger seat and Elisa squeezes into the back seat as you sit on the tip of Elisa's snout. Viola opens the glove compartment and to Lydia's surprise, reveals an older male human sleeping inside. "Up and at them, Sterling." Says Viola to her husband. Viola's husband springs up and then notices Lydia and Elisa. Before he can say anything, Viola covers his mouth with one of her fingers. "In case you're wondering. These girls will be filling in for Pam until she's back on her feet." Sterling looks at Lydia nervously. "Are you sure that's a good idea, Viola." Viola gives a scoff. "Direopolis is full of kooks, Sterling. One or two more won't make much of a difference."

With that, Viola starts the car and drives away on her way to Direopolis. "Is Neo Neapolitan a particularly popular restaurant, Viola?" asks Elisa. Viola nods her head and moos. "It's the most popular restaurant in Direopolis. Mainly because of its unusual menu. It helps that most monsters in Direopolis are large women with larger appetites." "So your sons and their wives make a lot of money." "Theoretically, yes," says Viola. "But a lot of times they have to give a chunk of their cash to Mia." "Mia Maza?" you ask. "You mean the handy woman? They need her, that much?" Sterling nods his head. "Yes." Elisa gives a gulp. "That's not a good sign. Uh, out of curiosity, how did Pam get injured in the first place."

Sterling rolls his eyes. "She was delivering pizza to one of the regular customers, a mad scientist and on the way out, she took out an unlabeled elixir from the fridge and drank it. It turned out to be an experimental rocket fuel that exploded as soon as she drank the whole thing. She's lucky to be alive but she'll be in the hospital for some kind." Lydia gives a scoff. "What kind of idiot would drink from an unlabeled vial?" "The sad part," says Viola. "That's not nearly the dumbest thing she's ever done. Then again, Norman was never any brighter." You start to think maybe this wasn't a good idea. Lydia even bites her nails.
1133221.title: Viola Road

11332211.content:
In a few hours, you all reach Direopolis. Viola parks in the parking lot of a strange looking restaurant that looked like it was pieced together from a pizzeria, donut shop, ice cream parlor, pancake house and 50s-style burger joint. You've heard of Neo Neapolitan, but this was the first time you've seen it. "Holy crap," says Elisa. "Who designed that place? Dr. Frankenstein?" Viola lets out a sigh. "My daughters-in-law couldn't agree on what to sell. Patty wanted to make the place a pizzeria, Salli wanted to sell burgers and pancakes, largely because of her own taste for blood but Pam wanted to make it into a donut shop." Lydia gives a scoff. "What a dump." "Well," you say. "That dump is the only job option you have right now." Sterling rolls his eyes. "Don't let Patty hear you call Neo Neapolitan a dump."

Elisa carries you and both she and Lydia follow Viola into the restaurant where two of the three proprietresses were waiting, both of which were nearly as tall as Viola herself and just as fat. First was Patty, the cook. She was an extremely pear-shaped and pink-skinned werehippopotamus with a blue tattoo of a pyramid over one of her eyes and long red hair that reached down towards her enormous rear. She was wearing a red tank top and skin tight black pants with an apron and gold jewelry. Next to her was Salli, the head waitress. You knew her all too well because she was Elektra's daughter, though thankfully she didn't share her mom's taste for human flesh. Salli was a vanilla-skinned hybrid of a loxodon and a vampire. She resembled an Asian elephant with vampire fangs in her mouth and her trunk and long black hair. She wore a gothic outfit with teal and black makeup and a hair clip shaped like a vampire bat. She was levitating off of the ground and carrying a large umbrella shaped like an imp. Both were accompanied by their human husbands. Patty's husband, Wes, was on the tip of her snout while Salli's husband, Allen, was hiding in his wife's ear.

"What?" asks Wes. "You found somebody to fill in for Pam and Norman? But, Mom..." Viola gave a snort and looked down at her son. "Is that a problem? You need a delivery girl and she needs work. Her landlady will skin her alive otherwise." Allen just gestures to Wes. "Humor her, bro. You know how nasty she can get when she's mad." Patty walks forward to inspect Lydia who growls slightly at her. "She doesn't look very friendly," says the hippo giantess. "I'm not so sure." "Oh, don't worry, Patty," says Viola. "As long as she's smarter than Pam." Patty rolls her eyes. "That's not much of an accomplishment, but she'll do until that stupid porker gets out of the hospital." Then Patty turns to Elisa and smiles at the bahamut woman. "Now, you," she says. "I've been waiting for another hippo girl to apply for the staff. Do you know how to cook?" "Well," says Elisa. "I breathe fire and sometimes use it to heat up my food." Patty then hands Elisa an apron. "Good," she says. "You can start in the kitchen. Your boyfriend can join you." Your eyes pop out. "Boyfriend?!" Patty must've thought you and Elisa were a couple.

As both hippo giantesses stomp towards the kitchen, Viola taps Patty on the shoulder. "Uh," she says. "While I have you, Patty. This morning I ate some delicious revolving sushi in Terrordale. Perhaps you should invest in something like that." Patty gives a snort. "I'll think about it, Viola. But where am I going to find somebody to run it for me? It's hard enough juggling burgers, pizzas, donuts, pancakes and sundaes. I'll let Dorothy find somebody once she gets back from Hawaii."

Lydia lets out a grumble as she takes out her bicycle and begins to adjust the wheels. "How demeaning," she says. "I'm a great sorceress and I'm forced to deliver takeout." While Lydia was groaning, Viola sat down at a table and placed Sterling on top as Salli walks up to take her order. "We'll take a half dozen meatball parm calzones." Says Viola. "And two diet Hauntling Colas." Says Sterling. Salli writes down the order but then she hears a phone ringing and answers it. "Hello?" she asks.

On the other end of the phone is a baku woman, you'd say 1075ft high. She resembled an anthropomorphic tapir with platinum skin and light purple stripes. She was bald but wore a pair of round glasses. From the looks of it, she was somewhat obese and she had her leg in a cast. "Hello, Salli," says the baku woman. "I heard from your mother-in-law that you have a new delivery girl." Salli gives a blink. "Mayor Merry," she says. "You're just in time. We need to break her in." The mayor gives a smile on the other end of the line. "Well," she says. "In that case, I'll take an order of 12 double cheeseburgers and 3 large fries." "And for the drink?" Mayor Merry scoffs. "I have drinks at home. Normally I'd come over, but that stupid succubus broke my leg the other day." Salli gives a trumpet. "At once. Lydia! We have a job for you."

- - -

It isn't long until Patty has finished the mayor's order (with help from Elisa). "Viola wasn't kidding," says Elisa. "Your customers sure do eat a lot." "That's what makes a restaurant a lucrative business in Direopolis." Says Patty. "Out of curiosity," says Elisa. "How much do you usually make on a weekly basis." "Depends." Says Patty. You blink. "Depends on what?" you ask. "A)," says Wes. "Depends on who comes in. Some of our customers are bigger gluttons than others and B) Depends on how much damage is done to Neo Neapolitan that week. A lot of that money goes towards paying Mia. Exactly how much money does your friend need to pay off your other boss?" Elisa bites her lips. "100,000 Skulls." Patty gives a look of shock. "Are you kidding me? You'd need Corona, Vienna, Claire and Mayor Merry to pop in for a meal for that to work and in the same week? That's not very likely. Heck. Even then, I doubt even they would order that much food. I'd suggest your friend find a second job somewhere in town."

You let out a sigh. Now, will you follow Lydia as she makes her delivery or will you stay in the kitchen and help Elisa?
11332211.title: Direopolis or Bust

choices: The Beauty Parlor or the Hotel
113322111.content:
As Lydia was getting ready to leave to delivery the mayor's order. Elisa waddles up behind her and gives a grunt. "Stephen will be coming with you." Lydia gives a scowl. "I sense a lack of trust." "Just making sure that you don't get into any kind of trouble. Salli told me this was a really strange town." Lydia moans before you're placed on the weasel giantess's shoulder and she rides off. Elisa shakes her head.

Lydia peddles her bike as she makes her way through Direopolis. "I hope that Helga can get the other half of the money you owe," you tell her. "It doesn't sound like this was a very profitable job." Lydia gives a glare. "I can make all the money without any help from that no account literal troll. I could just as easily find a second job out here." "But Neo Neapolitan closes at 8," you say. "I don't like your chances. And you only have 7 days." Lydia sticks out her tongue but then she hears a siren blaring. "What the?" you ask. "Were we going over the speed limit?"

A car pulls up and you see that the driver is a mountain ranger. From the looks of it, she was a chubby but hourglass-shaped teal-skinned weredolphin with violet hair. She resembled a humanoid porpoise dressed as a Texas ranger. "Hold it right there, kamaitachi," she says. "I don't think I've ever seen you in town." Lydia gives a growl. "I'm just delivery the mayor's lunch. I work for Neo Neapolitan." The dolphin giantess looks around and inspects Lydia but she's not convinced. "What kind of a rube do you take me for?" she asks. "The delivery girl for Neo Neapolitan is Pamela Petunia Hocker, a wereboar. Height: 1350ft. Weight: 1800lbs (in scale). Hair: Blonde. I.Q.: Very low. You don't match that description. More than likely, you're an identity thief who has kidnapped and/or murdered the real Pam Hocker and stolen her job."

You blink. "Are you kidding me?" you ask. You heard that the mountain rangers were the closest thing Direopolis had to the police. But from the looks of it, this dolphin giantess was the most incompetent cop you've ever met. Roxy's sister, Petra, should've seen what a dummy this woman was. "You moron," you say. "Lydia is a temp. Pam is in the hospital. Call the doctor. Call Patty and Salli. They'll confirm the story." The dolphin giantess, who you identify as "Delphine" from her name tag, is skeptical but calls the restaurant. At that time, Viola and Sterling were in the middle of their meal when Salli flies up to the phone. "Hello?" asks Salli. "Mrs. Van Richter," says Delphine. "I have an identity thief claiming to be your delivery girl here." Salli lets out a sigh. "She's a temporary delivery girl, Delphine," says Salli. "Pam hurt herself on the job and had to be hospitalized. It will be a week before she's back." Salli then hangs up and lets out a sigh. "What's wrong?" asks Elisa. Patty lets out a sigh. "One of our customers," she says. "Delphine. She's an inept mountain ranger who jumps to conclusions all the time.

Back with you and Lydia, Delphine gives a glare. “Your story checks out, but I’m keeping an eye on you, weasel. They don’t give this badge to just anybody you know.” Lydia gives a growl. “It sounds like that’s EXACTLY who they give a badge to around here.” Delphine gives a glare and then drives off, leaving you and Lydia to make your delivery. “Geez,” you say. “That was harrowing.” Lydia gives a growl. “Just as long as we get to the mayor’s house without anything bad happening. I don’t even know if there’s a time limit I’m supposed to be delivering this food within.”

Fortunately, Lydia makes her way to Mayor Merry's Japanese-style house and walks in the front door. The baku giantess takes the food and pays Lydia as she gives a smile. "Thanks, Ms..." "Lydia," says Lydia. "By the way, Ms. Mayor, do you know anybody else who is looking for somebody to do paid work in Direopolis?" Mayor Merry bites into a burger before the tapir-like giantess answers. "Well," she says. "I'm not sure that it's a good idea while you're already working for Patty and Salli, but I've heard some rumors. Hmm. There's no way Cora will hire you. You're a kamaitachi. I heard Trini was offering money to participate in one of her experiments." "Trini?" asks Lydia. "Who's that?" "She's our local inventor. Don't tell her I said it, but she's kind of a bumbler." Lydia's eyes pop and twitch when she hears the word "inventor". "No way!" yells Lydia. "I'm not that desperate." Mayor Merry scratches her injured leg before letting out a slight belch.

"Well," she says. "There are only three other jobs I can think of. One of Claire's maids at the hotel quit due to Brenda insulting her. Honestly, I don't know why Claire hasn't fired or eaten her yet. Mrs. Oda is also looking for help at the beauty parlor. Finally, Deneb is looking for a housekeeper to tend to her place while she's at... "work"." Lydia nods her head and then starts to ride her bicycle away. "Uh," you say as you ride on Lydia's shoulder. "Lydia? Neo Neapolitan is the other way." "I'm not riding to Neo Neapolitan. I'm going to apply for a second job." "I don't think that's a good idea. Patty and Salli might not like it." Lydia gives a growl. "I'm not going to let Helga outdo me."

You let out a sigh as Lydia rides all the way to...
113322111.title: Follow Lydia

1133221112.content: Well, which one is it?
1133221112.title: The Beauty Parlor or the Hotel

choices: That Stupid Ranger Stops You Again
11332211121.content:
Lydia rides up towards a beauty parlor of some sort. It was a Japanese style place with anime portraits of the monster visitors painted on the sides of the walls and the barber poles appeared to have stripes shaped like dragons. You just stare at Lydia. "Lydia," you say. "This isn't a good idea. After all, juggling a job in a restaurant and a job that involves falling hair? That's a bad combination." Lydia gives a hiss. "Come on," she says. "There's no way I can make 100,000 skulls in one week working at Neo Neapolitan. I just hope most citizens aren't as bald as the mayor."

Lydia walks inside to see a fat apple-shaped Japanese dragon teenager with purple skin and a yellow underbelly. She had bright red hair that looked as though it was dyed. From her uniform, she worked at the parlor. She was fixing a barber's chair while there was another dragon in the corner. This one was an elderly-looking male dragon with pale green skin and from the looks of it, he had fallen asleep reading the newspaper. You look closer and see the newspaper was written in braille. The male dragon was blind like Zoey. You then notice that there was a pitch dark room in the back, hidden by curtains.

Lydia scratches the window to get the teen dragon's attention, as she bumps her head on a ceiling fan and grunts. "Excuse me," says Lydia. "Is the boss here hiring any new hair stylists." The teenage dragon turns her head and notices Lydia. She sees Lydia's apron and realizes she's a delivery girl for Neo Neapolitan. "Oh. You must be the stand in for Mrs. Hocker. Wait. Why do you want a job here if you already work for Mrs. Round and Mrs. Van Richter?" Lydia gives a scoff. "I need a lot of money to pay off a debt in only a week. Who's in charge around here." The teenage dragon scratches the back of her head. "Well, my mom's the boss, but she doesn't really like having strangers in the house. I'll go ask her."

The teenage dragoness walks into the back room and then you and Lydia give looks of surprise as you hear loud stomping noises. "What the heck was that?!" you yell. From what you could tell, who or whatever made those stomping sounds was at least 4 times bigger and 10 times heavier than that teenage dragon. "Hey, Mom." you hear the teen dragon's voice say. "What is it, Akira?" asks a surprisingly light and feminine sounding voice from what was obviously a particularly large monster. You give a look of surprise. "Wow," you say. "That huge dragon is the boss?" Lydia gulps. "I don't think whatever is in there is a dragon. She's clearly some kind of monster big enough to use dragons as dental floss." You blow on your finger as Akira speaks again.

"There's a kamaitachi lady in here who wants a job. But she's already working for Patty and Salli." "Hmm. I'll have to think of some reasonable hours but alright. Tell her she starts first thing tomorrow." "Okay, Mom." Akira walks out of the back room and you hear her mother stomping away. "Good news, Miss," says Akira. "You have the job. Just one condition." "And what is that?" asks Lydia in confusion. "The condition is that you aren't allowed to watch mom as she's working." You give a gulp. "Your mom must be enormous based on her footsteps." Akira nods her head. "She is. She's the biggest monster I know. She makes Patty, Salli and Pam look like dwarves in comparison." You gulp. That woman sounds like she could make Petra look like an ant.

After leaving the beauty parlor, Lydia was wheeling back to Neo Neapolitan. "I don't think you should take that job, Lydia," you say. "You don't even know what kind of creature you're working for. You said yourself she was too big to be a dragon." Lydia gives a scoff. "You worry too much."

At that moment...
11332211121.title: Come Into the Parlor

113322111211.content:
Lydia arrives with her bike outside of Neo Neapolitan and gives a confident smile. You shake your head. "You're a glutton for punishment, you know that, don't you, Lydia." Lydia gives a scoff. "I can handle two jobs." "Well," you say. "I should hope so. Patty and Salli won't like it if they find out you're moonlighting." Lydia gives a scoff. "You worry too much. And if you tell Salli or Patty or even Elisa, I'll eat you." Lydia snaps her teeth and you gulp as you get the message. As you and Lydia enter the restaurant, you see Salli on the phone. "Another customer?" asks Lydia.

Salli shakes her head. "Not exactly. But it does have a way for you to earn some extra cash to pay off your debt." You give a look of surprise. "Uh-oh." You think. Lydia, however, apparently not satisfied with the two jobs she had already scored, smirked. "Oh really?" she asks. "What do I have to do?" Allen climbs the tip of Salli's trunk before speaking. "Pam's brother Lon is looking for somebody to help him with his landscaping work, just for the afternoon." You give a blink. "Pam has a brother?" you ask. Patty shakes her head. "Brothers. Plural. Pam has one older brother, one younger brother, one older sister and one younger sister. Unfortunately, when it came to brains, it was first come first served and Pam's older sister didn't leave anything left for the rest of the clan."

"Exactly why does Lon need Lydia to help him." Wes let out a sigh. "Because he just got through with an appointment with the eye doctor and Vienna recently hired him as her gardener." Elisa's jaw drops. "Vienna?!" she yells. "The gargoyle jazz singer!? She lives here!?" "Oh yes," says Patty. "Vienna is an old friend of mine." "You're sisters-in-law with Corona Poe and you're a friend of Vienna's?" asks Elisa in more shock. "You have connections, girl." Patty nods her head but then you hear the sound of an engine. "What is that?" Wes rolls his eyes. "Lon, probably. I know the sound of his obnoxious motorcycle anywhere." You and Lydia give looks of horror. "You mean the guy just came out of the eye doctor's office and he's driving a motorcycle!?" you yell.

There is a loud screeching sound and you look forward to see a motorcycle coming right at the door. The rider of the motorcycle was a purple-skinned and slightly chubby male wereboar with long platinum blonde hair and what looked like a goatee riding forward. He was wearing a motocross outfit and a pair of goggles. From the looks of it, several of his teeth, including one of his tusks, had been replaced with gold. The pig man clearly couldn't see where he was going because he wound up shattering the front door before finally stopping on one of the tables as he let out a loud squeal and crash landed in the corner.

Patty slaps herself in the face and mutters as the wereboar giant gets up and shakes his head. "One of these days," he said. "I've got to get those brakes fixed." "Geez, Lon," growls Patty. "Do you want to join your big sister in the hospital." "Get off my case, Patty," says Lon as he holds his head. "Pam is right. You are a hothead." Patty glares and then shakes the frying pan in her hand at the time. "Must resist. Must resist." Salli however, has more patience with the pig man and floats up to him. "Hey, Lon. We found somebody to help you out at Vienna's." Lon gives a squeal and then squints as Lydia walks forward. "I didn't know there was a troll in this town." Lydia gives a growl. "I'm not a troll, you moron! I'm a kamaitachi!" "Lydia," you say. "I'd be careful."

Lydia realizes her mistake and clears her throat. "I'm sorry about that. Lydia Kama. I'm ready for some landscaping." Lon gives a snort. "Great," he said. "I was afraid that I was going to be alone with blurry eyes working around Vienna's garden." Elisa rolls her own eyes. "Does asking for time off mean anything to you?" Lydia follows Lon and you crawl up to the weasel giantess's ear. "I don't know about this, Lydia. Anybody who tries to drive a motorcycle after getting his pupils dilated can't possibly be the best person to work for." "It's just for the day, bug! Shut it!" Lon is about to get on his bike but Lydia stops him. "Oh no," she says. "I saw you driving. I'm taking over."

Lydia gets on the bike as Lon gets in the sidecar and then she jets off screaming. From the look on Lydia's face, she had never even rode a motorcycle much less drove one and you had to hold onto the tip of Lydia's ear to avoid being tossed out into the city. "This was a bad idea!" you yell. It isn't long until...
113322111211.title: Glutton for Punishment

11332211122.content:
Lydia makes her way towards the hotel. From the looks of it, it was a large and mildly opulent looking hotel that had a sign outside depicting a chameleon with rainbow stripes and a bright tongue. Lydia gave a laugh. "With two jobs, I'll have that money back in no time." "I don't know, Lydia. If Patty and Salli find out you're moonlighting, I don't think that they'll like it. Besides, I heard the CEO of this particular hotel chain is very neurotic. I wouldn't want to work for somebody who's emotionally unstable." Lydia then squeezes you and you grunt before the weasel giantess looks down at you. "Well, I heard that Miss Melon is the only regular customer at Neo Neapolitan who swallows humans. Maybe I'll offer you up as a snack to settle the deal." You decide to shut up, you were getting nowhere.

As Lydia was walking up towards the hotel, a rather fat werehyena with golden fur walked by and she stared at Lydia. "Don't tell me that you're applying for a job here?" asked the hyena giantess. "You're in for a colossal headache." You give a gulp. "Claire is that hard to work for?" The hyena gave a scoff. "The boss isn't the problem. There is one very rude fellow employee who worked my last nerve. It's lucky for her that it's illegal for monsters to eat humans in Direopolis. That's the only reason she's survived so long. I don't know why Miss Melon doesn't just fire her. Believe me, if she wants me back, a raise won't be enough." The hyena giantess walks away and you blink. But Lydia doesn't take the warning seriously and walks into the hotel, the gargoyle doorman lets her in with no problem. The manager is a bright pink furred wendigo without any horns on her head. "Excuse me," says Lydia. "Who am I supposed to go to to get the maid position." The wendigo gives a blink. "Oh," she says. "I'll take you right to Ms. Melon's office. She'll be in shortly."

The manager leads Lydia to the office and knocks on the door. "Hello, Ms. Melon? Huh, guess she isn't here yet. Wait right here." Lydia rolls her eyes and walks into the office and places you on Claire's desk. She looks around and sees paintings of dinosaurs on the wall that looked expensive." You walk on Claire's desk and see a photograph of what you assume to be Claire herself and another monster woman. From the photograph, you see that Claire is apparently a rather fat and bottom heavy silver-skinned werelizard resembling a chameleon with a hunched back and long red hair worn in a bob cut. From the looks of it, her tongue was multi-colored, which explained the name of her hotel chain. There was another lizard woman in the photograph, most likely her sister. Claire’s sister was a brass-skinned frilled werelizard with a red and yellow-colored frill and short blue hair (though you didn’t know if it was natural or dyed). From the looks of it, she was chubby and bottom heavy but not nearly as heavyset as Claire.

“Lydia,” you say. “You can’t wait around all day for Claire. If you take too long coming back from delivering the mayor’s food, Patty and Salli might fire you.” Lydia gave a scoff. “Oh please,” she says. “Claire probably pays twice as much as those...” Before Lydia finishes her sentence, she hears yelling. “I’m warning you, Brenda! If you keep up with your bad attitude, I swear, I’ll transfer you to our hotel in Panicburg!” yells a rather stressed out sounding contralto. You’re so shocked you fall and land in the seat of Claire’s chair and grunt. At that moment, Claire walks into her office twitching. Claire stood 875ft high making her almost three times as big as Lydia. She was grumbling to herself and then walked over to a coffee machine in the corner of the room to fix herself a cup and Lydia looked in surprise as Claire dumped half a sugar bowl into her cup and let out a sigh. “Why is good help so hard to find,” muttered Claire to herself. “You try to offer equal opportunity for humans and monsters but some of them just have to be...” It was at that moment, Claire realized that Lydia was in the room and then she turned and looked in surprise.

Wasting no time, Claire walks over to her chair and you gasp as you look up and see her enormous rear. It was almost as big as Patty’s and completely dwarfed the chair. She was wearing underwear that appeared to bear a Jurassic Park logo. You then try to run as her rear comes down like the asteroid that killed the dinosaurs, but it is to no avail as you’re completely trapped underneath Claire’s massive behind. You let out a groan as Claire speaks with Lydia. “What do you want?” asks Claire. Lydia is at first nervous but then speaks. “Well, I came to apply for the maid job.” Claire simply stares at Lydia. “Do you have any experience?” “I’m a sorceress.” “I’m not looking for a sorceress. I’m looking for a maid to replace Juliet. I have a very important clientele coming and I can’t settle for amateurs.” “Oh come on,” says Lydia. “Have I heart. I need to pay off my debts from a lodge that burned down.” Claire clutches her chest and gasps. “Burned down!? You mean to tell me your lodgings caught on fire? You didn’t have anything to do with it, did you. If you think I’m allowing a fire hazard in my hotel, you’re out of your mind.” “It wasn’t me! It was a stupid troll fiddling with strange gadgets.”

Lydia then screams as Claire lashes out her tongue to catch a butterfly that flies over Lydia’s head and then pulls it back into her mouth before chewing it like bubblegum and swallowing it. “I’m giving you a trial run,” says Claire. “I expect you to be here at 6 tonight. Don’t be late. If you do a good job, I might keep you.” With that Lydia smiles and walks out, leaving you trapped under Claire’s behind. You let out muffled yells but neither Lydia nor Claire hears you. It looks like you’ll be trapped under Claire for....
11332211122.title: Lizard Large and In Charge

choices: The Window is Open. The Mine Goes Off Harmlessly
The Window is Closed. The Wall is Destroyed
113322112.content:
You figured it was safer to stay in the kitchen with Elisa. Elisa was busy flipping a pizza while Patty was busy frosting some of the donuts. You and Wes were helping out by pushing some of the pizza ingredients out where Elisa could grab them. "I gotta say, Stephen," says Wes. "That's quite a predicament. It sounds like Lydia and Helga get along well as Pam and Corona." "Corona?" you ask. "Wait! I'm an idiot! Viola Poe, Corona Poe! Corona Poe is your stepsister!? That's incredible." "Yeah," says Wes. "And we knew here before she became famous. I hope Lydia gets along better with Corona than Corona does with Pam." "Corona doesn't get along with Pam?" Wes lets out a sigh. "Corona used to have a human boyfriend herself. They were inseparable. Unfortunately, he was killed by a wereboar. Pam is a wereboar. Do the math."

You nod your head. "I see. Does she get along better with Salli and Patty?" "Oh yes. In fact, if we didn't go to the same school as Corona, Allen, Norman and I would've never met our wives. Patty, Salli and Pam have trouble getting along with each other, but that's mainly because we see each other on a daily basis and drive each other nuts. But we're still a close family." You give a gulp. "I've already seen how Allen gets along well with Elektra. Do any of you have other issues with your in-laws." Wes bites his lips. "Actually, Salli's dad gets along well with Allen." "He's a vampire right?" "Yeah, but he doesn't prey on humans. I think that's why he and Elektra got divorced. As for Norman, he gets along well with Pam's parents and her siblings. Ironically the moron has the least amount of in-law trouble." "What about you, Wes." Wes gives a grumble. "Don't get me wrong," says the oldest Wraith brother. "Neith is easy enough to get along with but that Carter really turns my wheels! Sometimes I'd like to strangle him."

You give a blink. "What could you do against him? He'd squash you like a bug." Wes gives a laugh. "Carter's not a monster. He's as human as you and me." You look back at Patty watching dishes and you're surprised. "Hold on," you say. "Humans can interbreed with monsters? Patty is half-human? She looks 100% werehippo to me." "Well she's half human. You can see it in her eyes." You then look back at Patty and Wes before speaking. "If she's half human and you're 100% human, then what will your kids look like?" Both Wes and Patty's eyes pop out and Patty even clutches her chest as if she was having a heart attack. Wes bites his beard and twitches his fingers before he puts his hand to his ear. "I think I left the teapot on." He said, dodging the question altogether.

You let out a sigh as you walk up to Elisa cutting up vegetables. "Elisa," says Destiny. "That's a pretty name. "Did your parents name you that for your midnight hair and tan skin." Elisa shrugs her shoulders. "I have no idea. It obviously wasn't meant to fit with my twin." "You have a twin sister?" "Yeah, but she doesn't look like me. Her name is Gia. I have another sister named Jeddah and she's younger." Patty nods her head. "Me. I never had sisters, but with the sisters-in-law I have, no thank you." "Patty," says Elisa as she chops some peppers. "Is it because you're the cook." Patty lets out a sigh. "If you must know, my full name is Cleopatra. I'm an Egyptian monster. By the way, I didn't know you were Stephen's girlfriend." Elisa scoffs as she cuts up some dinosaur meat. "I'm not. I don't even have a crush on anyone." Patty gives a smug grin. "Maybe a big purple man will come in and change your life." Elisa gives a scoff. "Very funny, Patty."

You decide to look through the window to the kitchen and see that Viola and Sterling are still the only customers and they had moved on to a neapolitan sundae. "Don't think we don't know what you're doing," says Sterling as he bites into a cherry the size of a wrecking ball. "It's still early. Somebody will pop in. Oops." Sterling slips and falls, covering himself in strawberry ice cream before Viola picks him up. She rolls her eyes and giggles before tossing her husband into her mouth and slamming her jaw shut. You gasp and scream as you see Viola swallow Sterling. "Oh my gosh!" "What's wrong?" asks Wade. You gag a few times before speaking. "Viola! Sterling! She ate her own husband!" Wes rolls his eyes and then points to Viola spitting Sterling back out into her hand, cleaned off. Both of them share a kiss before going back to their dessert as you look in confusion. "Oh," you say. "I forgot minotaurs were still bovids." "Don't worry," says Wes. "Dad's indestructible, just like us. I think he even enjoys it."

You let out a sigh before another customer comes in. This customer was a giant light blue-skinned Loch Ness Monster woman with long white hair. She was very obese, especially below the belt. She wore a Saturday-style spandex orange and black outfit and what looked like an engagement ring on her finger. She was carrying a cooler in one hand and a tackle box in the other. Apparently she fished for a living. "Oh," says Salli as Elisa walks out of the kitchen. "It's Lapis." "Lapis?" asks Elisa. "Is she a customer." "Yes," says Allen. "And the opposite. She comes by the restaurant to sell the fish she catches."

Salli floats up as Lapis smiles and takes out her wares. There was a giant squid with horns, a flounder with the pattern of a bumblebee and a fish that looked like a hybrid of a lobster and an octopus. You let out a whistle. "Wow," you say. "Look at all those fish." Lapis then takes out what looks like a big ball of seaweed. "What is that?" asks Allen. Lapis scratched her head. "I don't really know. I pulled it up from Neptune knows where. I thought you could use the seaweed to make a salad. Elisa rubs her chin and rips off the seaweed and what she sees makes her and you scream. "What?" asks Lapis before she sees what she caught and gasps. "Oh ****!" Allen screams at the sight.

As it turns out, what Lapis hooked up was a sea mine. "A mine!" yells Salli. Allen hides in Salli's ear as Patty and Wes drop their jaws. "Oh no." Says Viola as Sterling hides in her hair. "Now, calm down," says Lapis. "This mine looks ancient. I'd say 100 years old. There's no way it's still active." Unfortunately, the mine began to hiss and Lapis tossed it to the side in fear. "Get rid of that mine!" yells Patty. Elisa grabs the mine and then throws it at the window, not checking to see if it was open first and you and Wes plug your ears.
113322112.title: Mine!

1133221122.content:
Unfortunately the window was closed so the mine goes off with a loud "BOOM!" and destroyed the entire side of the wall.

"Good grief." You say. Patty lets out a sigh. "This is why we can't get insurance." "Look on the bright side, Patty," says Salli. "At least it wasn't Pam's fault this time." Patty covers her face and starts swearing in Swahili as she waddles up to the phone. "Better call Mia." She says as she dials the phone. Elisa places you on Patty's shoulder next to Wes so you can overhear the conversation. Suddenly you hear somebody pick up the phone and what sounds like a toilet flushing in the background. "Patty," groans Mia. "I should've known. I'll be over in two shakes of a cat's butt." Mia then hangs up and Wes lets out a sigh. "Mia comes over so often to fix shit that we might as well put her on the payroll." "How much does Roxy's cousin usually charge?" asks Elisa. Salli gives a trumpet. "Let me put it this way. She's practically the fifth richest citizen of Direopolis." Elisa bites her lip and soon enough, Mia walks in and is shocked at the damage done.

"What the hell happened here? It looks like a mine went off!" At that moment, Lydia comes back from her delivery and is smiling as she has the payoff in her hands and is counting it. "I gotta say," says Lydia. "I'm not much for this town, but the mayor sure is a big tipper. At this rate I'll be able to pay off my debt in no time." That's what Lydia thought, but Mia takes the money from her hand. "Hey!" yells the weasel as Mia puts the cash away. "This is a down payment," she says. "You can pay the rest after I'm done." Mia then switches her prosthetic hand for one that ended in a drill and whirled it as she picked up some screws and planks of wood. Lydia then notices the hole and gasps. "Please tell me that's an inexpensive hole." She says. Mia gives a scoff. "At this size? I'd say it's worth at least 1000 skulls. The entire wall needs to be replaced." Lydia gives a loud yell and pulls her ears in frustration. "One step forward and three steps back!"

Elisa then walks over and Mia notices her and you. "Hi, Elisa. Hey, Stephen." "Hey, Mia," you say. "You come here often?" Mia points to her large behind and growls. "These danger magnets keep me so busy that I have to eat most of my meals here." Elisa then has an idea. "Hey, Mia. You think you'd be interested in repairing Grimmsly Lodge? Half the place was damaged in a fire." "Who's the idiot who started the fire?" "Idiots," you say. "Plural. One of them is the kamaitachi subbing for Pam. She and the other idiot have to earn 100,000 skulls in one week." Mia stops and replaces her drill hand with a hammer hand before Patty hands her a milkshake to drink. "Seriously? That much damage. I guess I could take a crack at it. As long as nothing happens to Neo Neapolitan in that time frame. Oh, but it can't be tomorrow. Vienna asked me to build a gazebo. And it also can't be on Monday. I've got an appointment with the dentist that day. Tuesday doesn't work either. Jury duty. And there's too much to do on Wednesday for me to even tell you. Of course, since Roxy is my cousin, I'll give you a discount."

Lydia gives a scoff and crosses her arms. "Well," she says. "That's gracious of you." Viola rolls her eyes as she starts licking her bowl. "I hope that Helga, whoever she is, is making more headway." Sterling nods his head before Salli answers the phone and nods her head before telling Patty the order. “Well,” you say. “It looks like Lydia’s getting a second... Ugh!” Lydia grabs you and squeezes you as she holds you up in the air. “And you’re coming with me this time, bug! I’m not letting some wereleopard abscond with any more of my cash.” Elisa lets out a sigh as Patty brings out the takeout. “So,” asks your bahamut friend. “Who’s next on the list for deliveries?”
1133221122.title: The Hole in the Wall

choices: There's a Large Broom You Can Use as a Weapon
11332211221.content:
"Two of our best customers ordered three meat lovers' pizzas," says Patty. "The Howler-Grunewalds." "Howler?" you ask. You remembered that Howler was April's last name. She must've had a relative in Direopolis, seeing as you knew for a fact that April came from a rather large family. "Howler?" asks Elisa. "Patty, this wouldn't happen to be a werewolf would it." Wes rolls his eyes. "With a name like Howler, no. She's actually a mummy." He says with a hint of sarcasm. "They're a two girl couple," says Salli. "Crescent Howler and Trini Grunewald. The former is an artist who specializes in sand castles and sculptures." You realize that Crescent would most likely be a relative of April's seeing as all of April's relatives you knew of were artists in one form or another. But sandcastles? You've seen a lot of sandcastles on the beach that were as big as actual castles but you never thought of sandcastles as being art.

"What about, Trini?" asks Elisa. "Is she a werewolf." "No," says Salli. "She's a saber-toothed tiger." "A saber-toothed tiger?!" you yell. "I thought those things were extinct." Patty gives a scoff. "Maybe in the human side of the world. She's actually a subspecies of weretiger. I gotta warn you, though." "Why?" you ask with a gulp. "Do those two like to... eat humans?" Salli gives a trumpet. "Don't worry. Crescent is allergic to humans. As far as I can tell, Claire is the only customer we have who likes to swallow humans." "Then what's so bad about those two?" asks Elisa as Patty comes out with the pizzas. Patty lets out a sigh. "A lot of Trini's inventions can wreak havoc."

Lydia gives a face like she's about to have a stroke. "An inventor!?" she yells. "Nuh-uh! There is no way I'm delivery food to one of those blights to the monster world! An inventor got me into this mess in the first place! Find somebody else to do it! Get Tanya to take it!" "That's not Tanya's job," says Patty. "It's your job." "Why is it MY job!? Why can't you or Salli delivery it." "Because Salli can't go out in the sunlight without burning herself," says Allen. "And Patty can't drive." Patty looms over Lydia angrily. "If you don't deliver these pizzas, I'm in the right to fire you." Lydia gives a growl and reluctantly takes the pizzas before walking out with you on her shoulder.

"I can't believe it! Me, a sorceress with style, forced to cater to a mad scientist!" You let out a sigh. "Would you knock it off. I don't know who this Trini is, but as far as you should be concerned, she's a customer. Patty said she and her wife are two of their best customers. Guess they're too busy to cook for themselves." Lydia let out a sigh as she peddled down the street.

It wasn't long until you and Lydia arrived outside of the Howler-Grunewalds' address. It was a strange high-tech looking building that appeared as if it came out a science fiction movie set thousands of years in the future. Outside were domes that contained sand sculptures that took on the shapes of different species of monsters as well as figures from mythology, strange-looking animals and one sculpture of a female werewolf eating a handful of humans while sitting on a pirate ship. "What an.... interesting decor. It's like the past meets the future. A sand sculptor and an inventor. I wonder how those two became an item." Lydia gives a scoff. "Who cares?" she asks. "Let's just deliver these pizzas and get out of here."

However, that was when you and Lydia freeze in place because you hear strange sirens. Out from behind the corner comes a strange-looking robot that had the lower half of a tank where its legs should be, a purple torso with a hunched back and lobster claws for hands and a head with a large red artificial jewel in the center of its video-camera-shaped face as well as a metallic looking hood that was the same color as its torso and looked welded to its body. robot made a buzzing noise as it looked up at you and Lydia.

"What is that?" asks Lydia. You give a gulp. "It must be one of Trini's inventions. Don't make any sudden moves." You and Lydia watch as the robot whirs and seems to scan you both. Its red jewel turns blue and then it beeps again. "INTRUDER DETECTED!" yells the robot in a high-pitched metallic sounding voice. "INTRUDER DETECTED! ASSUMING DEFENSE PROTOCOL!" Lydia gives a growl and holds her claws. "Insolent machine!" "Wait," you say. "That robot must be a guard. We're new in town, so it doesn't recognize us and can't tell if we're friend or foe." Lydia takes out her wand. "Oh yeah," she says. "I'll fix this robot's wagon!" However, the robot fires a laser beam from its jewel and melts Lydia's wand as Lydia looks in fear.

The robot beeped again. "HOSTILE INTRUDER DETECTED! ASSUMING ATTACK PROTOCOL!" You and Lydia are forced to run as the weasel giantess is chased by the irate defense robot.
