The robot shoots what appear to be cherry bombs from its claws and even singes the tip of Lydia's tail as Lydia screams. Lydia even drops one of the pizzas where it is run over by the robot. The cheese splatters all over the robot and it begins to spark and twirl around as it shoots lasers more erratically and forces Lydia on all fours as you grab her by the tip of her ear. "Now it's malfunctioning! I just hope those two won't miss just one pizza." Lydia lets out a scream as a laser burns her other ear and you bite your nails as the robot gets closer.

However, you and Lydia see salvation as up ahead...
11332211221.title: Into the Scientist's Pot

choices: Continue with Stephen, Elisa and Roxy Reading the Paper
Continue wit Azure in Under Gloom
1133222.content:
To yours and Elisa’s mutual surprise, Lydia returns with a suitcase full of money. “Hubba what?” asks Elisa in surprise as she drops her jaw and exposes her enormous teeth. Lydia gives a laugh and shakes the suitcase. “Surprised?” she asks. “Yeah, we’re surprised,” you say in a skeptical tone. “How on Earth did you manage to get that much money so fast. How can we be sure that stuff isn’t counterfeit that you just magicked up.” Lydia gave a scoff. “You sound just like that moron, Helga. It’s real money. That you can be sure of. And from the looks of it, it’s enough to cover my debts. Hee, hee, hee.” With that, the obese weasel giantess walks away as you and Elisa follow her in disbelief. “There’s no way she could get 100,000 skulls that fast,” said Elisa. “Something’s up.” You nod your head in agreement. It seemed too fast.

- -

Soon, Lydia returns to the lodge and hands the money to Azure as Helga looks on in absolute shock. “What the?!” asks Helga. “How did...!? What ha..!?” Azure flips through the suitcase and counts all the money as Vernon sits on her shoulder. “Well I’ll be dipped,” says Azure. “It’s all here. Exactly 100,000 skulls. That’s remarkable and unbelievable.” Lydia gives a smug smirk. “And I covered it all myself while a certain troll was slacking off.” Helga gives a glare because she’s clearly suspicious. “How did you earn all that money in so little time? I’d bet 100,000 skulls that your 100,000 skulls is fake.” Vernon climbs down onto Azure’s large belly and looks over the money. “No,” he says. “This is definitely real money. Non of the serial numbers are the same so it can’t be counterfeit.” Lydia gives a laugh as Helga is incensed. “And you didn’t do anything to help pay off the damage that YOUR machines did to the hotel. If I were you, I’d be looking for another place to live.” Lydia laughs and walks away as Helga jumps up and down in rage.

Roxy is just as surprised. “You say that you took your eyes off her for only half an hour and she earned 100,000 skulls?” Elisa gives a grunt as she stuffs her face with pretzels. “That’s exactly what happened. It doesn’t sit well with me.” “Then where did she get the money?” asks Roxy. “It doesn’t make any sense.” You let out a sigh. “Well,” you say. “Azure had to send the guests home and give the staff time off until the place is back in order. Maybe we shouldn’t look a gift horse in the mouth.” Roxy lets out a sigh. “I guess.” She says.

- -

Much later, Azure, Felicia and Vernon have returned to their house in the city and Felicia is busy playing a video game while Azure is fixing herself a sandwich in the kitchen. “How long until the lodge is back in order, Mom?” asks Felicia. Azure chops some salami before she answers her werejaguar daughter. “It will be 3 weeks,” says the werecoyote giantess. “But at least Lydia came through with the money.” “Well,” says Vernon. “It’s the least she can do after she and Helga let half the lodge burn down with their bickering. Things are really looking up.” Azure nods her head before she starts to walk into the living room with her lunch. It was at that moment there was a knock on the door.

Felicia puts her video game on pause and answers the door before giving a look of shock. “Uh... Mom.” Into the room walked a policewomen. She was a red-furred and haired obese werecheetah woman with speckles all over her body. “Is there a problem officer?” asks Azure. The policewoman lowers her sunglasses and glares at Azure. “Azure and Vernon Skinwalker, you are under arrest for robbing the Terrordale 1st National Bank.” Azure and Vernon give looks of shock as Felicia gasps and drops her game controller. “There has to be some sort of mistake,” says Azure. “I was nowhere near the bank.” “No mistake,” says the cheetah woman. “100,000 skulls mysteriously disappeared from the bank and the Vulcan construction company reports that you paid the exact amount to them for reparations to the Grimmsly Lodge owner by you. In addition to the bank staff, your fingerprints were found all over the money.

Azure’s eyes pop and she realizes what happened. “Great Wankatanka!” Azure thinks to herself. “Lydia must’ve robbed the bank. Note to self: when I get out of this, I’m going to KILL that weasel. “Officer,” says Felicia. “There’s some mistake. My mom’s no criminal. She wasn’t anywhere near the bank. One of her tenants....” But unfortunately, the policewoman isn’t willing to listen and slams the cuffs on Azure before hauling her away as Felicia can only watch in horror.

The next day...
1133222.title: Azure's Bad Day

choices: Kate Heading to Under Gloom to Meet with Azure
Felicia Managing Grimmsly Lodge in Azure's Place
11332222.content:
The next day, Azure was in Under Gloom and was wearing a black and white striped prison outfit. Vernon was in the same cell and Azure gave a growl as a yellow-skinned hourglass-shaped manticore woman in a green prison staff outfit was outside. "I'm telling you, Vice Warden," says Azure with a growl. "I didn't rob the bank. One of my tenants did and tried to use stolen money to pay off her debt." The manticore gave a scoff. "You must think I'm stupid. Like I haven't heard that excuse before." "I want to see the actual warden." Complains Azure. The manticore shakes her head. "No can do, Mrs. Skinwalker," she says. "The warden is out sick with a cold. I'm the warden today and I don't believe you one bit." The vice warden then turns and licks her lips as she spots Vernon. "And just in case your husband tries to escape, here's a fair warning; a lot of the staff and inmates love to nom on humans." The vice warden laughs wickedly and walks away.

In rage, Azure scratches the cell walls. "Just wait'll I get my hands on that weasel! I'm going to murder her!" Vernon blows in his wife's ear. "We're already in enough trouble, Azure. Threatening to kill Lydia isn't going to help our case." Azure gives another growl before she sits down on her prison cot which breaks under her weight and leads to her prat falling. Azure rubs her behind in pain and growls to herself.

Soon Azure is in the prison cafeteria and looks at what passes for food in Under Gloom. She sniffs her tray and gags. "What the heck is this gunk?" asks Vernon. "I've been eating monster food for 22 years and I've never seen anything so putrid looking." Azure gives a groan. "Monster food is already unappetizing to humans as it is, so when it comes to prison food, they have to go the extra mile. This slop looks outright poisonous." It was at that moment another inmate sat down next to Azure. She was a centaur with the lower body of a quagga, dark skin and a garish looking face with her prison uniform reduced to a bra. She looked very interested in Azure who gave a growl at her. The centaur girl then looks at Vernon and licks her lips. "Are you going to eat that human?" Azure bites the centaur girl's hand as she reaches for Vernon and makes her scream in pain. The centaur blows on her hand before Azure growls again to tell her to back off.

After lunch, it's visiting hours and Felicia is visiting her mother in prison. "I can't believe Lydia would stoop to bank robbery," says Felicia. "Don't worry, Mom. Dad. I'll get you both out of this." "I hope you're not planning to break us out, Felicia," says Azure. "I don't want Lydia dragging you down either." Felicia gives a hopeful smile. "Actually," she says. "I hired a lawyer to spring you. She'll be over later." Vernon gives a gulp. "Which lawyer?" he asks in worry. Felicia gives a purr. "Kate Rowling." "Kate Rowling!?" yells Azure. "Hiring that harpy costs an arm and a leg!" "But she's good at what she does, Mom. She’ll get you out of here.” Azure lets out a sigh. “Why not?” she asks. “I have nothing else left to lose. Besides, I can always beat the money out of Lydia’s hide later. I just hope that she hurries. I don’t like the looks of some of the inmates.” Vernon gives a scoff. “How do you think I feel? That overweight hyena guard tried to eat me while I was locked in the jail cell.” Azure just lets out a sigh. “Just please try to keep what’s left of Grimmsly Lodge in tact. Above all, Felicia, do NOT let any more inventors or sorceresses onto the premises. Try to limit the damage. Until I get out of this mess, you’re in charge. Do not let ANYONE walk all over you.”
 
Felicia nods her head. “Yes, Mom.” Azure gives a somber look and kisses her daughter before visiting hours end and Felicia walks away. “I sure hope Mrs. Rowling will be enough to get Mom and Dad out of the slammer.” As Azure and Vernon were being walked away by the onryo serving as the temporary vice warden, Azure raises an eyebrow. “How exactly did the regular warden get sick?” The onryo lets out a sigh. “One of our more troublesome inmates tried to escape when his cellmate was on garden duty. It rained that night and the warden spent hours chasing that creep. Her daughter always warned her that creep was ruining her health.” Azure let out a sigh.
 
We now cut to...

(Note: For more info on Kate Rowling, see Monster Cove)
11332222.title: Azure Behind Bars

114.content:
However, this excitement is not even close to one today. Corey (the yeti) was seen entering the lodge for a suprise insepction, kinda shocking everyone including Roxy. She doesn't seem very happy at all to be here today just as she was mad for some reason. "Hello, this is Corey and I am here for an inspection today." she said, just as she looks at Roxy sternly. "What's the big deal? Everything is going fine, plus were you supposed to be here on Friday?" Roxy asked her. "Today's Wednesday."

"I am having to do this inspection ahead of time because for some reason. My inspection company is going all sorts out of wack lately, plus I just decided to come here as those FREAKING SKIERS AND SNOWBOARDERS GIVES ME A PROBLEM! You better hope this place passes, otherwise you are out of the job here as the place will close." she smirked just as she begins her inspection in the...?
114.title: Oh boy?

choices: She now heads into the Rooms
She now heads into the Office
1141.content:
Corey begins her dreadful examination of the kitchen. She goes into the kitchen to see that all the tables are nicely clean and rid of all crap that would smell like ass. It was a good start for the kitchen as the customers are reporting food experience. 12.content:
You figure Roxy’s probably busy, so you decide that you’d go help Elisa, your secondary partner, teach guests how to ski. You walk right to the front door, reasoning that Elisa was probably already outside. She was a monster called a bahamut, a creature you were certain only one exists. According to Arabian myth, it was a fish with a hippopotamus’s head that supported the world while in Dungeons and Dragons Bahamut was a dragon. Elisa however combined the two viewpoints, being a hippo with a dragon’s wings, and a fish’s gills. She was also carnivorous but fortunately for you she didn’t eat humans. You were actually scared of her when Roxy introduced you but you got used to Elisa fast.

As you walk out the front door, a strong cold wind blows past you and you hold onto yourself tight so as not to be blown away. But it wasn’t the cold you had to worry about because you felt tremors, except they weren’t as powerful as a monster’s footsteps. There was something big coming forward, but this something big was something small compared to the monsters. The only thing it could possibly be was a dinosaur. While dinosaurs were extinct in the human world, they were very abundant in the monster world and were considered a delicacy. In fact, they were Elisa’s favorite snack. But unfortunately the dinosaur right in front of you was a big tyrannosaurus rex and he looked hungry. The t-rex roars loudly and you scream as you’re forced to run. Just your luck that the dinosaurs in the area somehow adapted to the cold. The tyrannosaurus snaps its jaws as it comes closer towards you and gains fast. And you just got away from Paisley season.

When it looks like the t-rex is going to grab you, it lets out a whimpering roar as something pulls it up into the air. You look up to see Elisa, your bahamut friend. Elisa licks her lips and opens her mouth wide before she drops the tyrannosaurus in her awaiting maw and swallows it whole. You tremble as you see a dinosaur shaped bulge travel struggling down her neck. While Elisa didn’t eat humans, you were scared to death of the fact that she ate dinosaurs. It reminded you what kind of titans you were dealing with.

Upon swallowing that rex, Elisa rubs her fat stomach. “Tyrannosaurus, my favorite flavor. Thanks for treating me to breakfast Stephen.” “Uh,” you mutter. “Thanks for saving me. But do you have to eat those big dinosaurs in front of me?” “Would you rather I eat you instead?” asks the dragon like fish hippo as she smiles and shows you her skyscraper sized teeth. “Uh no,” you say. “That’s perfectly fine.” Elisa lets out a loud laugh. “Just kidding Stephen. You know I don’t eat humans. No offense but you guys taste horrible.” You let out a sigh of relief, thankful that you won’t be Elisa’s meal anytime soon.

Then Elisa lowers a clawed finger for you to climb on before she places you gently in her scarf. “Come on bite-sized,” she says teasingly. “Time for work. There’re several new guests itching to hit the mountain.” The hippo dragoness flaps her wings and you hold on tight to her scarf as she flies you away. It wasn’t easy being a ski instructor to giant monster girls, but at least you had Elisa to help you. “There she is.” The bahamut says. You both fly down and you look to see that your first ski student of the day is...

124.content:
You both fly down and you look to see that your first ski student of the day was a female Pandaren. She stood at 100 feet tall, small for a monster, must have been a kid, you guessed.

"Hello," she said politely, then she spotted you and her vision seemed to tunnel. "My name's Siobhan" she said.

"Si-bob-han?" Elisa said uncertainly.

The female panda growled in annoyance, clearly used to having had to explain this quite a bit. "It's pronounced Sheh-bahn for those two aren't familiar with it." she said with a shrug, not taking her eyes off you or even blinking. It was making you nervous, "since mom was a banshee, I was given an Irish name. My FATHER was the werebear."

HUH?! She was a hybrid?! Well...that was nothing unusual. But China and Ireland...long distance relationship and unusual combination.

Ooo-kayyy! Could she PLEASE stop staring at you!?

"Say...do you mind if we stop at the lodge, I'd kill for a steak right now." the pandaren asked. Would she PLEASE AT LEAST BLINK?!

"Steak? Aren't pandarens vegetarians?" your Bahamut co-worker asked.

"I'm not," Siobhan said. Her attention still not leaving you.

CRIPS! She's a carnivore?! Was that why you were so firmly in her sights to where she was only just barely acknowledging Elisa's existence compared to you?!

"...or rather, I CAN'T. I was born with a condition that makes it so my body only accepts meat, and to prove it, all you have to do is take a look..."

She smiled and you yelped in surprise, nearly falling off Elisa's scarf.

Only accept meat...no kidding! Siobhan had teeth like a mako shark!

Her smile turned apologetic. "Sorry, little one. Don't worry...I don't eat humans. Well...not the good ones, part of the condition is pretty odd: the lower their morals, the more compelled I am to eat them. Because of that, the Under Gloom warden wants to hire me."

You sigh in relief, thank god for that! But now Elisa was looking confused. "UNDER GLOOM?! How could the warden have the gall to hire you?! You're what? Twelve years old?"

"I was born September 7th, 1988. Malnourishment because my body can only accept one kind of food's made me short for my age." Siobhan growled, her fingers twitching dangerously. As though aiming to strangle someone.

The Behemoth gulped and backed away nervously. "Ahaha...my bad. Sorry!"

You clear your throat, "Well, back to the matter at hand...you're hear to learn to ski, right?" you said, aiming to get this hybrid's attention off your friend.

At that, the banshee/pandaren nodded, then went to get a pair of skis, then held out a paw-like hand for you to climb on.

"Well...you're the instructor, right? Let's go!" she said happily.

Elisa looked miffed at the fact that the newbie wanted YOU to teach her, but you shrug and climb onto Siobhan's hand. Yeesh...! They were so warm, you actually considered ditching the winter-wear.

Placing you deep in her scarf and tightening it so that you think the only way you'd ever get loose would be if you snapped in half, your new trainee wadded towards the bunny slopes, leaving Elisa standing where she was.

"Ready? I know it's not a sleigh ride, but we could have a good time, little guy!" she purred, suddenly with a lustful tone as she started batting her eyelashes.

HUH?!

Before you could make sense of the crazy mood-change, Siobhan propelled herself forward and down the slope. The icy are making you push it out of your mind.
124.title: Black-&-white banshee hybrid

Elisa at this time had returned to the lodge and was looking out the window to see the hybrid sliding down the hill and then shook her head before drinking some hot cocoa. "Something bothering you, Elisa?" asks Roxy as she bites into a sausage. "I'm a little concerned about Siobhan asking Stephen alone to be her instructor. After all, there are a lot of monster girls who want him as their boyfriend." Roxy turned and pointed specifically to Felicia and Dinah who were waiting on tables behind her. Siobhan was rushing down the mountain and laughing as you turn and see some large mountains that were covered in snow. "Siobhan," you say. "Be careful. Too many loud noises could set off an avalanche." But Siobhan just kept on giggling as she leaned forward. Her laughter makes your ears hurt which is only natural since she's half banshee. But as Siobhan keeps on laughing, the snow starts to rumble and you look to see that the snow was coming down faster and faster.

"Siobhan!" you yell. "What?!" yells the pandaren somewhat irritably, unintentionally releasing a sonic blast that strikes the mountainside. Both of you stop and slowly slip down the slope as the snow begins to rumble and zoom down from the mountainside. "Avalanche!" both of you shout.

The snow comes rushing down and Siobhan skis faster as you hold onto her tight. Elisa and Roxy see the snow coming down from the mountainside from the lodge window and look in horror. "Good grief!" yells Roxy. "Oh no!" yells Elisa. Both the gargoyle and bahamut run out and spread their wings. "I am not letting Stephen become the next Fatima." Said Elisa.

While Elisa and Roxy are flying off, you and Siobhan are going down faster as the snow keeps following you both. "Faster!" you yell as Siobhan keeps skiing. You then scream because more and more snow rolls down, enough for an ocean.

As the bahamut-girl slows to a stop, gently lowering herself to the ground with each flap of the wing, you climb out of the scarf somewhat to get a glimpse of who you'd be teaching today. It was always a good idea to know what you're dealing with when it comes to monster girls. Something about how they looked was usually a big enough clue as to what their thoughts on humans were, and if you would look like a bite size snack to them. You mostly avoid the werewolves, though. Although April was kind to you back at the beach, you've come to learn that werewolves being friendly to humans is...not a common trait.

Looking over the rim of the scarf, though, you get a good glimpse of the monster you were dealing with, but aren't entirely sure what you were looking at. It looked kind of like a rabbit, but with horns? That can't be right. Unfortunately, as you lean even closer over the edge to take her in, Elisa touches down with a thud, and, expecting you to be contained snugly inside her scarf, didn't bother to make sure you wouldn't go flying forward. Which is exactly what you did. You let out a yell as you fall forward a hundred feet or two infront of Elisa, landing in the thick monster snow with a thud. Standing upright and brushing it off, you look up to see Elisa walking over you to greet the monster. Crap. Didn't she see you fall out?

With some effort, due to your body sinking down a couple feet in the snow as you try to walk, you make your way around the bahamut, about to yell at her to pick you up, when you stop and look towards the monster you're going to be training, deciding that now would be as good of a time as ever to get acquainted with the sight of her. Your previous thoughts were now confirmed; she was some kind of monster you've never seen before.

The strong legs and drooping ears, along with the poofy tail, nearly made you brush it off as a were-rabbit, but the horns on her head proved this to not be the case. You thought about it. You know that this kind of monster had a name of some kind, but names failed you at the moment. You'll remember it later, probably. Either way, you get another good look at her as Elisa and this girl talk about...whatever they're talking about. This woman is, unlike the vast majority of monsters you've seen, rather petite. She was quite clearly an adult, but her body shape was deceiving. Aside from her legs, which you guessed were full of muscle after years of jumping, her frame was rather thin, and concealed inside a thick winter jacket and matching pants. You wondered why a creature covered in fur would need such a warm coat, but her fur didn't look particularly thick, and probably didn't help all that much.

"...and here's my partner now!" said Elisa, stealing your attention as you look towards the bahamut. She's prying open the scarf to show you to this girl! "I know you might not have expected to see a human working with me, but...Stephen?" she asks, looking concerned as she doesn't find you between herself and the scarf. "Stephen, where did you do?" "Elisa! I'm over here!" you yell, and the bahamut looks even more confused, looking around her body to find you, as if you're stowed away on her and she just hasn't spotted you. The rabbit(?) woman, however, spots you instantly.

You let out a yelp as she reaches down, grabbing you with furred fingers and hoisting you into the air. You feel momentarily sick as she lifts you up faster then you expected, before suddenly stopping and unfurling her hand, holding you above her face in what looks like awe. Her face was very animalistic, and very much resembled a rabbits, aside from a few minor human-like traits such as feminine eyebrows and a more human-like mouth, though still very rabbit-like. You're honestly terrified. You had no idea if this thing was a human eater or not. And now, you were at her mercy. She didn't seem to regard you as food, though. She just looked curious, moving her hand around and eyeing you up and down. "Wow... I never thought I'd see one so close!" she muttered, and it hit you. This was the girl's first time seeing a human. She looked to be an adult, though, so that was very curious. How could a monster not have seen a human, given how often they're devoured in the monster world?

"Jacky, could I have him back?" says Elisa, and, reluctantly, 'Jacky' gives hands you off to the bahamut again, and she sets you back down near her scarf, only you hold on tighter this time. "Stephen, this is Jacky the Jackalope. Jacky, this is Stephen. He's my partner." You look over at Jacky and she gives a nervous smile. This girl had clearly never seen a human before, so in the interest of giving her the right idea about your species, you offer your hand out for her to shake. "Hello, Jacky. My name's Stephen. Nice to meet you." She extends her hand to shake back, but quickly realizing that it wouldn't work, she touches your hand with her pinky finger, still larger than you, and tries her best to shake. You look up at Elisa, who only smiles in response. Jacky seemed kind towards you...but mostly ignorant about humans. You now wanted to leave a good impression on her, so that way she'd be able to help out other humans in the future, and not, well, eat them.

As Jacky and Elisa prepare for the snowboarding lessons, of which are Jacky's first, you decide you should strike up a conversation with Jacky. Maybe she'd feel a little less apprehensive to talk to you if you warmed up to her. She already seemed to like you, but was still curious, glancing at you often while she and Elisa talked. Your goal was to make sure this girl got a good idea of how good humanity can be, and not how tasty it can be. So, as the lessons have nearly begun, you begin to talk to the Jackalope...
125.title: New Character 4

choices: "Help Out Ripple in the Kitchen. But be Careful"
"Check up on Helga. She's Working on a New Invention"
"Check on Lydia, she's Late with the Rent"
"Fatima's Causing Trouble Again. Go Calm Her Down"
13.content:
You suddenly remember that your boss, Azure the werecoyote wanted you to come into her office. She was going to give you a special job for the day. You liked Azure. She was just like Fran in that she was friendly to humans. But she went farther than Fran because she actually married a human. Even though she and Vernon have been together for 25 years now, you wonder how they made it work seeing as she was 140 times bigger than than he was and she was a monster species that normally eats humans.

You walk under the door to Azure’s office and saw the stairway up to her desk. She installed it so Vernon could get around without getting stepped on. You walk up the stairs to see Vernon was already there painting his giant wife’s fingernails. “Hey Stephen,” Vernon says. “How’s life treating you?” “Fine Vernon. Good morning Azure.” Azure turns her head and looks down on you with a smile. “Good morning Stephen. On time as always. No wonder Roxy recommended you.” You give a nervous laugh.

Vernon then lets out a grunt as Azure grabs him by the shirt. “That’s enough for now Dear. Stephen and I have to talk.” Azure stretches out the front of her pants before she places Vernon gently inside and snaps them back. Azure giggles as her husband struggles and tickles her. Then she begins to moan in ecstasy and you look in slight disgust. Was this really the right time for them to be doing that?

“You wanted to see me Azure. Am I in trouble.” Azure lets out a laugh but you can’t tell if it’s from you asking her the question or her husband tickling her. “Far from it Stephen. I just noticed you’ve been helping Roxy and Elisa out a lot.” “But that’s a good thing. They’ve got two of the most important jobs at the resort. Uh, after you of course boss.” “That’s just it,” says Azure with a sigh. “You’re working too hard with those two. Maybe you need a change of pace. I have a different job for you today.”

You cross your fingers and hope with all your might that she’s assigning you to help Connie as a tour guide. You said you were going to summon the courage to ask the naga giantess on a date all Summer but you blew it and never got around to it. This could be a second chance. You’d really like Connie to be your girlfriend one of these days.

But even though Connie was a coworker and not just a guest in the winter time, you had other things you could be doing. There was another coworker named Ripple, a three headed cerberus with a head for rage, sorrow and joy. But the heads kept shifting which one controlled her body and the three contrasting personalities made her very dangerous. Of course, Azure would never intentionally put you in harm’s way.

But maybe you’d be assigned to check on the boarders. There were two monsters who rented the rooms below Grimmsly Lodge. First was Helga, the daughter of Fran, your boss at your Summer job. Helga was an inventor and the smartest monster you knew. It made you wonder how someone like Fran could’ve possibly given birth to her. The other boarder was a capricious kamaitachi weasel sorceress named Lydia. Lydia and Helga hated each other and were usually feuding over something stupid. For neighbors they didn’t get along well.

Then last would be a problem that wasn’t even a coworker (anymore). Fatima, the Wraith of the last human who worked at the lodge. She was blown away in a snowstorm and froze to death before anyone could find her. It was nobody’s fault, but she doesn’t realize that Azure, Elisa and Roxy searched everywhere to find her. That ghost monster thinks her friends abandoned her and she plays mean practical jokes and causes trouble in the lodge for revenge. Usually, you have to pacify that big undead baby and it’s never any fun.

“So Azure,” you say. “What’s my job for today?”
13.title: Coyote Beauty

132.content:
"I think.... oh..." moans Azure in pleasure. "Oh, harder baby. After 25 years you haven't lost your touch." You raise your eye in discomfort. Why did Azure have to do that with Vernon in plain view of you? Sure he was hidden in her pants... but still, it's indecent. You clear your throat to remind Azure of why she called you in.

"Oh," says your werecoyote boss as she starts to sweat. "Stephen, I want you to be careful for today's assignment. You're going to be working with Ripple in the kitchen today. She's preparing some difficult dishes today I suggested for the guests. Stegosaurus pot pie, millipede stir fry..." You gag and hold your mouth. "One of these days," you say. "I've got to get used to monster food one of these days." That's when Azure looks at you sternly. "Be on high alert. You know how unstable that cerberus is. I don't want to see you hurt or worse."

You immediately salute Azure and go down the stairs to leave her to the husband in her underwear. You were used to talking to multiple headed monsters due to your experiences with Laura, the four headed hydra scuba diver in the Summer. But Ripple wasn't like most three headed monsters. All three of her heads had incompatible personalities that matched the highlights in their hair. The left head dubbed Ripple Yellow was always happy and excited while the right head, Ripple Blue, is a pessimistic crybaby who only looks on the dark side. The most dangerous head was in the center and called Ripple Red. Ripple Red was constantly pissed off and highly aggressive. Unlike Ripple Yellow and Blue, the middle head is a predator who eats humans.

What makes the heads scarier is that they take turns controlling the body and they switch at random. But you're almost there. You walk into the Grimmsly Cafe, momentarily hiding behind a barstool as that human eating loxodon Elektra walks by with her trunk in the air. As Elektra stops to sniff the air, you make a run for the kitchen and roll under the door before you let out a sigh of relief.

You smell the air and recognize the sent of brachiosaurus sausage before looking up to see Ripple's well muscular back as she's working on the grill. "Hi Ripple!" you yell up. "Good morning!" Ripple begins to turn around, but which of the cerberus chef's heads is in control of the body today?
132.title: Someone's in the Kitchen with Ripple

choices: Kari and Sonia, the drider sisters
1321.content:
Surpisingly, it's the Ripple yellow head that is working today with you, the other 2 heads are just resting it out today to give her a shot, and she looks happy to see you today. "Hello Stephen, looks you and I are working today together. I will keep your job easy, I need you to taste the food and tell me what you think of it. Is it bland, is it raw (unless it's chicken), is it perfect, etc? Just taste it and tell me." she said, and then she hands you your first meal to taste test.

Stegosaurus pot pie was your first meal to taste today. You take a quick bite out of it, and you notice that it's pretty cold. "Uh... Ripple, we got a cold pot pie, put it back in the heater for a few more minutes." you said, and then Ripple came by, and to be sure, she taste it as well, and you were right, it was cold. "You're right, cold, putting it in the heater right now Stephy." she said, putting the microwave back in. She gave you zombie meatloaf, and you take a bite out of it, and you threw up. "It's raw!" you replied. "Oh man, it is, got to cook it a little more." Ripple said, grabbing the zombie and cooking it a little more.

This job was easy, but nasty as well, as you are tasting food to make sure it was good, and anything that isn't good has to be sent back, you don't want your people to be unhappy. And then, the door comes in, but who is it?
1321.title: Taste testing!

13212.content:
"Oh fuck, Corey's here." you told Ripple yellow before Red came along. "WHAT THE FUCK?! COREY, OH NO!!! WE'RE ALL SCREWED!!!!!!!!!!!!" she screamed in panic just as everyone gets the food ready for the yeti girl known as Corey ready. You presented your meals down to Corey, and she begins tasting them. "Man, this is a joke." Corey said, before she started to eat the food that she was presented. Stegosaurus pot pie, zombie meatloaf, etc.

Corey hated all of the food she was eating, as she found it completely disgusting, even for monster standards, and she notices alot fo grease on her food, and even threw up vomit all over them, and then she screamed to the top of her lungs this. "THIS IS THE WORST PIECE OF SHIT I HAVE EVER TASTED IN ALL OF MY LIFE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" Corey yelled out before she came into the kitchen herself in a steaming rage, and then notices it the ultimate sin of all. The kitchen was an absolute mess, with Ripple's 3 heads cooking food. Corey then fainted.

"Oh god, we failed." you said.

"Yes you did, and now...." Corey yelled out as she got up in rage.
13212.title: The worst thing I ever tasted in my whole life!

choices: Ripple starts chasing you through the lodge.
13213.content:
The two driders skitter in, the younger one looking upset.

"What seems to be the problem?" Ripple asks. Surely there was nothing wrong with the food THEY made.

"Well....um.......its just...." Sonia mutters....before Kari moves her out of the way. "The flies in her fly burger were undercooked!" she exclaimed. "She could have gotten sick! Who's checking quality around here." You nervously raise your hand as Sonia notices you and walks over.

"Um...." you say nervously as Sonia picks you up "I did. I only checked the burger and not the flies inside. I didn't notice I guess. I'm sorry." Sonia stares at you causing you to fear you're about to be eaten in response, before she gives you a cute smile. "Oh don't worry about it little human. I really don't mind. My sister is just such a worrier. i didn't know they had a human in the kitchen." She holds you up towards Kari. "See...the human didn't mean it."

"Well......I guess no harm done." she says. "Sorry for complaining." You sigh with relief before suddenly hearing a growl behind you. "YOU DIDN'T CHECK THE FLIES!" Ripple roars. Uh oh. The angry head has taken over. "N...no Ripple. But I'm sorry...I promise I'll....." Ripple starts shoving through the kitchen towards you. Looks like you've got a problem.
13213.title: Kari and Sonia, the drider sisters

132131.content:
Just as you seemly might be reaching for your death sentence at the hands of a Ripple, suddenly one of the driders comes to your ad and grabs you suddenly, just before Ripple was able to eat you right then. This makes you relieved, but it surely makes Ripple pissed off, as you made a mistake and just wanted to eat you. Soon, the drider soon revealed to be Kari. “It’s alright Stephen, I know you didn’t mean to do it.” she said nicely enough to ensure that you aren’t getting harmed at all, and then Kari turned to Ripple with a rude face.

“What, he is my problem, not yours, so back off!” Ripple shouted with all 3 heads, now being taking over with the angriest head now thanks to all of this mess. “Well maybe you should pick on someone your own size.” Kari smirked, just as she punches her in the face, and suddenly knocks her out. Kari isn’t a bad person at all, and if other monsters get onto her, then you know what’s coming.

“Sorry still about the burger. I will get you two a new one.” You replied to them.

What do the girls say?
132131.title: Kari to the rescue

133.content:
"Well Helga is working on a new invention for you so your life here can be alot more easier here, and she asked me to tell you to go for her, so you can see what it is. She does said that you are going to like it..." Azure sajd to you to restly assure you that this is for your own benefit, and that it will be a very big help for you, so you accepts. "Okay... You know, being a human worker in a slopes for monsters is sometimes pretty stressful." you added.

You then navigate your way to the halls, but suddenly you are picked up by someone on your way there. You then see that it was Helga who picked you up, and she walks to her lab. "Figure I give your legs a but of a rest after a long walk. There is something I am making for, what to know what it is?" She asked as she walks there.

"Sure...." You replied.
133.title: "Check up on Helga. She's Working on a ...

1332.content:
In the center of Helga's laboratory, Helga has what appears to be a strange device in the center of the floor. "What is that?" you ask the troll giantess. "That's my latest project," says Helga as she adjusts her glasses and puts you in the center of the device. The device had a spiral shape in the center of what looked like a planetary grid. As Helga was making some adjustments to what looked like a handheld, oversized motherboard-like device, you look around.

There were machines of all sorts that looked too complicated to even guess what they were supposed to do along with a large master computer with several monitors that looked linked together. There was even a machine that looked similar to Iron Man's armor, albeit distinctively more troll shaped and colored red, green and black. Helga was very good with tools and gadgets and spoke perfect English. That made it unbelievable that she was the daughter of your other boss, Fran.

While Fran was as friendly as Azure was, the troll from the beach was just plain stupid to the point of speaking like the Hulk before later cartoons started portraying him smarter. Fran was barely one step ahead of a caveman. But Helga on the other hand was the smartest monster you knew. How a smart cookie like Helga could've been given birth by a bunt cake like Fran was beyond you.

"There," said Fran. "And done. Stephen, that machine you are standing on right now, is in fact a teleported that I've been working on in order to help you better move around the lodge without having to worry about predators like Elektra and Comet or rely on Elisa or Roxy to carry you around."

"How does it work?" you ask. Helga bent down and showed you the motherboard-like device that was beeping in her hands. "I still have to install the other teleportation pads but this handheld control will allow you to be zapped anywhere in the hotel. Of course, it would only work if you're on the teleportation pad when it activates." You smile. That would save you a lot of trouble.

Or so you thought, because at that moment, without even warning, Fatima appears above you and lets out a shriek. Helga screams in response and drops the control panel. This caused it to break and unfortunately for you, it activated the teleportation pad and you let out a scream as the transporter broke you down into particles before zapping them away to reconstruct you elsewhere.

As Fatima faded away laughing, Helga gasps. "Oh no!" she yelled. "This is terrible. By my calculations, Stephen has been teleported to the other side of Mons Terra." Helga wasn't kidding. You had been teleported to a far, far away city in a part of the monster world you had never even knew existed. Where are you.

(Note: Here, I want writers to make up their own monster location and describe the area around it)
1332.title: Zapped

choices: You Can Stay, But On One Condition
13321.content:
You look around in surprise at your surroundings. One second you were in the lodge and now you're on the sidewalk in some huge city. You are immediately assaulted by the cold and start shivering. You start walking but have no idea where you are going. You don't know where this place is but you know Helga's machine probably had a hand in sending you here. Looking around you see that the buildings have a Victorian style to them. You decide to get inside one of them and warm up so you turn toward the closest one. As you approach it you suddenly feel a huge presence bearing down on you and turn in time to see a giant set of talons coming from above. They land on the ground and you find yourself wedged in between two of them. Looking up you see that they belong to a chubby harpy girl with blue feathers and average sized breasts. She's wearing a white blouse and a black skirt that reaches down to the point where her bird legs begin. Her hair is blue like her feathers and is short and very straight. She walks forward and enters the building, taking you with her.

Upon entering the building you feel much better. The heat from her talons and the warmth from being inside feel great. You don't know if this girl is friendly or not but you need some help. You begin knocking on her talons hoping she'll feel you. You succeed and she looks down. When she sees you her eyes widen and her hair raises a little bit. "A human?" she says and reaches down to pick you from her foot. "Hello there." she says politely. You hear that she has a British accent. "Hi there my name is Stephen." you say. "I hate to ask but I'm in sort of a bind and could use some help." she smiles and pats your head. "Of course, I'll help any way I can. My name is Jaylene" This girl is very polite. You're glad she's the first person you met.

Just then you hear someone else coming and see a huge werewolf girl with pure white fur and long flowing black hair. She's got an hourglass figure and is wearing some sort of dark purple gown with long sleeves. Although it doesn't really show any of her fur you can tell her boobs are fairly large. She passes by and glances at you in Jaylene's hand. She stops and leans forward to give you a sniff. You don't know what she's doing but then she walks away. "Are you planning to eat that?" she asks Jaylene. "Of course not!" your new friend answers. "He's lost and needs help!" The wolfess heads into another room while Jaylene follows. "Good, he doesn't seem to be of good quality." You don't know whether you should feel relieved that you're not going to be eaten or insulted. "This is Snow Howler." Jaylene tells you. She likes to eat humans but only those she deems acceptable." You nod and look around to see you're in what appears to be a sitting room. Like the outside this place gives off a Victorian era feel. Even the way the two girls are dressed seems that way, and Snow has British accent like Jaylene. "Excuse me." you call up. "But what is this city called?" Jaylene blinks and tilts her head. "Why this is Chillingham." she answers. Chillingham? You've never even heard of it, but it gives an obvious British feel.

Snow pours herself a cup of tea as well as one for for Jaylene. Then you hear rumbling and another monster enters. This one is a sort of Frankenstein monster. She's pear shaped and her skin is slightly green. You can see stitches in various places where her different parts were sewn together. She has wavy red hair reaching her back and her chest is big, but her hips are bigger by comparison. She's wearing a tight button up shirt and a long skirt, and there are two . "Hello everyone!" she says as she enters. When she sees you she leans in quickly and studies you intently. "Jaylene, where did you find this human?" she asks. "Just outside, he's lost and needs help." Jaylene answers. The new girl grabs you and holds you up to her huge face. "My name is Mary and I'd be glad to help you! You can stay in my room with me and we can get to know each other better!" she says. You are gently snatched away by Jaylene. "Mary is a bit of romantic." she explains. Mary folds her arms. "That may be, but I can just tell he's special!" You roll your eyes. You're actually used to this kind of thing.

Another girl enters next but this one doesn't make any stomping sounds. Thats because she slithers in on a giant black snake tail. She's a naga like Connie and has light skin with shoulder length brown hair. She's quite fat but is pretty attractive. She's wearing a tight shirt like Mary. As she gets closer she spots you and smiles. "Would you be willing to share that little morsel?" she asks Jaylene. "No, Addy, I'm helping him!" Jaylene says protectively. "Well maybe I'll help myself to him later." the naga tells her while eying you hungrily. You were kind of hoping she'd be friendly like Connie but you can't win every time.

As the girls all get settled and relaxed a huge vampire woman comes in the room. She's taller than the others and has purple skin with long black hair. She's got a voluptuous figure with huge breasts and hips. "Hello girls!" she says cheerily. "Hello Miss Tu!" the girls answer in unison. "I trust your day is going well!" she asks as she pours herself a cup of tea. "Yes, I can't really complain." Snow says as she sips her tea. "Yes, and I found my soul mate!" Mary tells the vampire. Miss Tu smiles. "Really? What is he like?" she asks. "Just see for yourself! Jaylene has him!" Mary answers. Looking over Miss Tu sees you and stands up quickly. "A human?" she says as she walks over. "What is someone as small as you doing here?" she asks. Realizing you haven't actually explained yet you tell everyone your story. "Terrordale?" Miss Tu says. "Thats practically on the other side of Mons Terra!" Just great. "My relative April lives in Terrordale." Snow says matter of factly. She's related to April? Compared to her cousin Snow is a bit snooty. "Can he stay here for now?" Jaylene asks. "Now you know this is a women only boarding house." Miss Tu tells her. "He's just a human! He won't cause any trouble!" the harpy pleads. What is Miss Tu's decision?
13321.title: Chillingham

133211.content:
"Oh, all right." Miss Tu says. "He can stay." Jaylene and Mary are both happy. "Yay! He can stay with me in my room!" Mary cheers as she grabs you. She hugs you to one of her boobs and smothers you for a second before you are grabbed by Miss Tu. "I think it would be best if he stayed with Jaylene." the massive vampire says. As she holds you you catch a glimpse of her massive cleavage and she gives you look. You turn away quickly but she shakes her head with a smile. Mary lets out a groan as you are handed back to Jaylene. Addy is giving you a hungry look while Snow doesn't seem to care at all. "Can I just spend a little time with him?" Mary pleads. "Lets give him some time to get settled first." Jaylene says and walks toward the stairs.

The harpy climbs the stairs and you catch one last wink from Mary as you go with her. When she reaches her room she enters and you look around. It seems pretty simple and is very tidy. Makes sense given her polite nature. She sets you down on her dresser and begins going through the drawers. "So are there any more girls living here?" you ask. "Oh yes. Jaylene answers. "There are quite a few, and Miss Tu looks out for us all. She's been around for a while." Thats very likely. Even though monsters age differently in general, vampires tend to live a long time. "Sorry about Addy though. Just try to keep away from her." she warns . "Don't worry, I'm used to being around monsters. I still think its lucky that Snow doesn't think I'm good enough to eat." you tell her. She pulls a shirt from her dresser and looks at you. "By the way, do you know her cousin?" she asks. You rub the back of your head and sigh. "Yeah...April is kind of in love with me." you admit. Jaylene has to stifle a laugh. "Really? From what I've heard, she doesn't eat humans but I didn't think she'd be in love with one." You shrug your shoulders. "It happens more than you think." you say, thinking about all the girls who are after you, including the Frankenstein you just met.

Jaylene makes the shirt she got out up into a little bed for you and places it on her bedside table. "You can sleep here." she says and places you in it. "Thanks." you tell her. You didn't even realize how late it was until she just said that. You begin to get comfy and notice that she's started to undress. She has her blouse off when she turns to face you. Her hair flies up and her face goes red. "I'm sorry! I can't believe I already forgot about you!" she stammers and rushes into the bathroom, grabbing her night clothes. When she comes out she's ready for bed, but her face is still flushed. "I'm just used to being alone in here." she says as she lays down for bed.

After a night's sleep you wake up and look toward Jaylene. She's still asleep so you decide to get out and explore. At first you hesitate, but its not like you've never been around a bunch of monsters girls before. You jump from the table to her bed and are greeted by her huge sleeping face. You look up at her and notice that she's quite pretty. Then her sleep breathing knocks you onto your butt and you decide to get going. You climb down her bed and make your way to the door. You slip under it and venture out into the hall. You walk for a bit and then a huge rumbling starts. Who is it?
133211.title: You Can Stay

choices: You Spend Some More Time With Snow
1332111.content:
Turning your head you see a huge white paw coming down. It just misses you and the impact causes you to bounce into the air. Its gotta be Snow. As she passes over you you get a peek under her gown and see her black lacy panties. When she's about to walk away you call up. "Snow!" you shout. Her ears twitch and she looks at the ground. When she spots you she walks back over. "Yes?" she asks, standing over you. You look straight up at her, with her boobs partially obscuring her face. "Do you think you could give me a lift?" you ask. The white wolfess sighs. "I suppose." she says and bends down, offering you a paw. You climb aboard and she carries you down the stairs.

"So how is April?" Snow asks as she enters the sitting room. "Oh she's great!" you answer. "She's just about the sweetest girl and is usually in a good mood." Snow nods and smiles. "Her trinket shop is doing well too." you say. "Her stuff is really popular with the beach goers and tourists. She's pretty successful I'd say." Snow nods again. "Well an artistic streak does run in the Howler family." she tells you. "I myself am quite adept at sewing." You look up at her interested. "Can I see some of your work?" you ask. Snow points over at a tapestry on the wall. "Thats one of mine." she says. The tapestry is incredible. It depicts a giant bat over a building that looks like the one you're in. The detail is amazing. The building looks so real, and there are even leaves blowing in the night air as well as a full moon. "I made that in gratitude for Miss Tu. She's a very good caretaker." Snow says. "Its awesome!" you tell her. Snow smiles proudly and scratches your head as if you're a small animal. "Why thank you." she says. "I make a living with my skill. I work freelance and make a good amount of money."

Snow gets up and walks over to a small stove that's set up in the room. There she begins making a pot of tea. "So are you and April a couple?" she asks out of nowhere.
